1 /**
  2  * @file treegrid.js
  3  * 
  4  * @brief 
  5  * TreeGrid is a visualization which represents data in a hierarchical grid 
  6  * view. It is designed to handle large amouts of data, and has options for lazy
  7  * loading. Items in the TreeGrid can contain custom HTML code. Information in 
  8  * one item can be spread over multiple columns, and can have action buttons on 
  9  * the right.
 10  * TreeGrid offers built in functionality to sort, arrange, and filter items. 
 11  * 
 12  * TreeGrid is part of the CHAP Links library.
 13  * 
 14  * TreeGrid is tested on Firefox 3.6, Safari 5.0, Chrome 6.0, Opera 10.6, and
 15  * Internet Explorer 9+.
 16  *
 17  * @license
 18  * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not
 19  * use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy 
 20  * of the License at
 21  * 
 22  * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
 23  * 
 24  * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
 25  * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT
 26  * WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the
 27  * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under
 28  * the License.
 29  *
 30  * Copyright (c) 2011-2012 Almende B.V. <http://links.sourceforge.net>
 31  *
 32  * @author   Jos de Jong, <jos@almende.org>
 33  * @date    2012-05-02
 34  * @version 1.0
 35  */

 60 /**
 61  * Declare a unique namespace for CHAP's Common Hybrid Visualisation Library,
 62  * "links"
 63  */ 
 64 if (typeof links === 'undefined') {
 65   links = {};
 66   // important: do not use var, as "var links = {};" will overwrite 
 67   //            the existing links variable value with undefined in IE8, IE7.  
 68 }
 69 
 70 
 71 /**
 72  * Ensure the variable google exists
 73  */ 
 74 if (typeof google === 'undefined') {
 75   google = undefined; 
 76   // important: do not use var, as "var google = undefined;" will overwrite 
 77   //            the existing google variable value with undefined in IE8, IE7.
 78 }

 81 /**
 82  * @class TreeGrid
 83  * The TreeGrid is a visualization to represent data in a  hierarchical list view.
 84  * 
 85  * TreeGrid is developed in javascript as a Google Visualization Chart.
 86  * 
 87  * @param {dom_element} container   The DOM element in which the TreeGrid will
 88  *                                  be created. Normally a div element.
 89  * @param {Object} options
 90  */
 91 links.TreeGrid = function(container, options) {
 92   // Internet Explorer does not support Array.indexof, 
 93   // so we define it here in that case
 94   // http://soledadpenades.com/2007/05/17/arrayindexof-in-internet-explorer/
 95   if(!Array.prototype.indexOf) {
 96     Array.prototype.indexOf = function(obj){
 97       for(var i = 0; i < this.length; i++){
 98         if(this[i] == obj){
 99           return i;
100         }
101       }
102       return -1;
103     }
104   }
105   http://links.sourceforge.net/treegrid/js/examples/example04_search_youtube.html
106   this.options = {
107     'width': '100%',
108     'height': '100%',
109     'padding': 4,               // px // TODO: padding is not yet used
110     'indentationWidth': 20,     // px
111     'items': {
112       'defaultHeight': 22,      // px
113       'minHeight': 24           // px 
114     },
115     //'dropAreaHeight': 10      // px // TODO: dropAreas
116     'dropAreaHeight': 0         // px
117   };
118 
119   // temporary warning
120   try {
121     if (options.itemHeight != undefined) {
122       console.log('WARNING: property option.itemHeight is no longer supported. ' +
123         'It is changed to options.items.defaultHeight');
124     }
125   }
126   catch (e) {} 
127 
128   if (options) {
129     links.TreeGrid.extend(this.options, options);
130   }
131 
132   // remove all elements from the container element.
133   while (container.hasChildNodes()) {
134     container.removeChild(container.firstChild);
135   }
136 
137   this.frame = new links.TreeGrid.Frame(container, this.options);
138   this.frame.setTreeGrid(this);
139   this.frame.repaint();
140   this.frame.reflow();
141 
142   // fire the ready event
143   this.trigger('ready');
144 };
145 
146 /**
147  * Recursively extend obj with all properties in newProps.
148  * @param {Object} obj
149  * @param {Object} newProps
150  */ 
151 links.TreeGrid.extend = function(obj, newProps) {
152   for (var i in newProps) {
153     if (newProps.hasOwnProperty(i)) {
154       if (obj[i] instanceof Object) {
155         if (newProps[i] instanceof Object) {
156           links.TreeGrid.extend(obj[i], newProps[i]);
157         }
158         else {
159           // value from newProps will be neglected
160         }
161       }
162       else {
163         obj[i] = newProps[i];
164       }
165     }
166   }
167 }
168 
169 /** 
170  * Main drawing logic. This is the function that needs to be called 
171  * in the html page, to draw the TreeGrid.
172  * 
173  * A data table with the events must be provided, and an options table. 
174  * 
175  * @param {links.DataConnector} data      A DataConnector 
176  * @param {name/value map} options  A name/value map containing settings
177  *                                  for the TreeGrid. Optional.
178  */
179 links.TreeGrid.prototype.draw = function(data, options) {
180   // TODO: support multiple input types: DataConnector, Google DataTable, JSON table, ...
181 
182   if (options) {
183     // merge options
184     links.TreeGrid.extend(this.options, options);
185   }
186 
187   var grid = new links.TreeGrid.Grid(data, this.options);
188   this.frame.setGrid(grid);
189 };
190 
191 /**
192  * Redraw the TreeGrid.
193  * This method can be used after the size of the TreeGrid changed, for example
194  * due to resizing of the page
195  */ 
196 links.TreeGrid.prototype.redraw = function() {
197   if (this.frame) {
198     this.frame.onRangeChange();
199   }
200 }

202 /**
203  * Base prototype for Frame, Grid, and Item
204  */ 
205 links.TreeGrid.Node = function () {
206   this.top = 0;
207   this.width = 0;
208   this.left = 0;
209   this.height = 0;
210   this.visible = true;
211   this.selected = false;
212 };
213 
214 /**
215  * Set a parent node for this node
216  * @param {links.TreeGrid.Node} parent
217  */ 
218 links.TreeGrid.Node.prototype.setParent = function(parent) {
219   this.parent = parent;
220 };
221 
222 /**
223  * get the absolute top position in pixels
224  * @return {Number} absTop
225  */ 
226 links.TreeGrid.Node.prototype.getAbsTop = function() {
227   return (this.parent ? this.parent.getAbsTop() : 0) + this.top;
228 };
229 
230 /**
231  * get the absolute left position in pixels
232  * @return {Number} absLeft
233  */ 
234 links.TreeGrid.Node.prototype.getAbsLeft = function() {
235   return (this.parent ? this.parent.getAbsLeft() : 0) + this.left;
236 };
237

246 /**

248  * @return {Number} width

251   return this.width;
252 };

254 /**
255  * get the relative left position in pixels, relative to its parent node

287  * Retrieve the main TreeGrid, the base object.
288  */

291 }

294  * Get all (globally) selected items
295  * @return {Array with Objects} selectedItems

302  * Get the HTML container where the HTML elements can be added
303  * @return {HTML DOM} container

309 /**
310  * Retrieve the currently visible window of the main frame
311  * @return {Object} window     Object containing parameters top, left, width, height
312  */ 
313 links.TreeGrid.Node.prototype.getVisibleWindow = function() {
314   if (this.parent) {
315     return this.parent.getVisibleWindow(); 
316   }
317   
318   return {
319     'top': 0, 
320     'left': 0, 
321     'width': 0, 
322     'height': 0
323   };
324 };

326 /**
327  * Change the visibility of this node
328  * @param {Boolean} visible    if true, node will be visible, else node will be
329  *                             hidden.
330  */ 
331 links.TreeGrid.Node.prototype.setVisible = function(visible) {
332   this.visible = (visible == true);
333 };
334 
335 /**
336  * Check if the node is currently visible
337  * @return {Boolean} visible
338  */ 
339 links.TreeGrid.Node.prototype.isVisible = function() {
340   return this.visible && (this.parent ? this.parent.isVisible() : true);
341 };

343 /**
344  * Update the height of this node when one of its childs is resized.
345  * This will not cause a reflow or repaint, but just updates the height.
346  * 
347  * @param {links.TreeGrid.Node} child     Child node which has been resized
348  * @param {Number} diffHeight             Change in height
349  */ 
350 links.TreeGrid.Node.prototype.updateHeight = function(child, diffHeight) {
351   // method must be implemented by all inherited prototypes
352 };
353 
354 /**
355  * Let the parent of this node know that the height of this node has changed
356  * This will not cause a repaint, but just updates the height of the parent 
357  * accordingly.   
358  * @param {Number} diffHeight    difference in height
359  */ 
360 links.TreeGrid.Node.prototype.onUpdateHeight = function (diffHeight) {
361   if (this.parent) {
362     this.parent.updateHeight(this, diffHeight);
363   }
364 }

369  *                              In that case, a redraw is required

371 links.TreeGrid.Node.prototype.repaint = function() {
372   // method must be implemented by all inherited prototypes
373   return false;
374 };

377  * Reflow. Calculate and position/resize the elements of this node
378  */ 
379 links.TreeGrid.Node.prototype.reflow = function() {
380   // method must be implemented by all inherited prototypes
381 }

383 /**
384  * Update. Will recalculate the visible area, and start loading missing data

386 links.TreeGrid.Node.prototype.update = function() {
387   // TODO: this must be implemented by all inherited prototypes

390 /**
391  * Remove the DOM of the node and set the node invisible
392  * This will cause a repaint and reflow
393  */ 
394 links.TreeGrid.Node.prototype.hide = function () {
395   this.setVisible(false);
396   this.repaint();
397   this.reflow();
398 };
399 
400 
401 /**
402  * Make the node visible and repaint it
403  */ 
404 links.TreeGrid.Node.prototype.show = function () {
405   this.setVisible(true);
406   this.repaint();
407 };

424 /**
425  * onResize will execute a reflow and a repaint.
426  */ 
427 links.TreeGrid.Node.prototype.onResize = function() {
428   if (this.parent && this.parent.onResize) {
429     this.parent.onResize();
430   }

434 /**
435  * The Frame is the base for a TreeGrid, it creates a DOM container and creates
436  * scrollbars etc.
437  */ 
438 links.TreeGrid.Frame = function (container, options) {
439   this.options = options;
440   this.container = container;
441 
442   this.dom = {};
443 
444   this.frameWidth = 0;
445   this.frameHeight = 0;
446 
447   this.grid = undefined;
448   this.eventParams = {};
449 
450   this.selection = []; // selected items
451 
452   this.top = 0;
453   this.left = 0;
454   this.window = {
455     'left': 0,
456     'top': 0,
457     'height': 0,
458     'width': 0
459   };
460 
461   // create the HTML DOM
462   this.repaint();
463 };
464 
465 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype = new links.TreeGrid.Node();;
466 
467 /**
468  * Trigger an event, but do this via the treegrid object
469  * @param {String} event
470  * @param {Object} params optional parameters
471  */ 
472 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.trigger = function(event, params) {
473   if (this.treegrid) {
474     this.treegrid.trigger(event, params);
475   }
476   else {
477     throw 'Error: cannot trigger an event because treegrid is missing';
478   }
479 }
480 
481 /**
482  * Get the HTML DOM container of the Frame
483  * @return {HTML DOM} container
484  */ 
485 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.getContainer = function () {
486   return this.dom.itemFrame;
487 };
488 
489 /**
490  * Retrieve the main TreeGrid, the base object.
491  */ 
492 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.getTreeGrid = function() {
493   return this.treegrid;
494 }
495 
496 /**
497  * set the main TreeGrid, the base object.
498  */ 
499 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.setTreeGrid = function(treegrid) {
500   this.treegrid = treegrid;
501 }
502 
503 /**
504  * Set a grid 
505  * @param {links.TreeGrid.Grid} grid
506  */ 
507 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.setGrid = function (grid) {
508   if (this.grid) {
509     // remove old grid
510     this.grid.hide();
511     delete this.grid;
512   }
513   
514   this.grid = grid;
515   this.grid.setParent(this);
516   this.gridHeight = this.grid.getHeight();
517 
518   this.update();
519   this.repaint();
520 };
521 
522 /**
523  * Get the absolute top position of the frame
524  * @return {Number} absTop
525  */ 
526 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.getAbsTop = function() {
527   return (this.verticalScroll ? -this.verticalScroll.get() : 0);
528 };
529 
530 /**
531  * onResize event. overwritten from Node
532  */ 
533 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.onResize = function() {
534   //console.log('Frame.onResize'); // TODO: cleanup
535 
536   this.repaint();
537 
538   var loopCount = 0;     // for safety
539   var maxLoopCount = 10;
540   while (this.reflow() && (loopCount < maxLoopCount)) {
541     this.update();
542     this.repaint();
543     loopCount++;
544   }
545   
546   if (loopCount >= maxLoopCount) {
547     try {
548       console.log('Warning: maximum number of loops exceeded');
549     } catch (err) {}
550   }
551 }
552 
553 /**
554  * The visible window changed, due 
555  */ 
556 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.onRangeChange = function() {
557   this._updateVisibleWindow();
558   this.update();
559   this.repaint();
560   
561   var loopCount = 0;     // for safety
562   var maxLoopCount = 10;
563   var resized = this.reflow(); 
564   while (this.reflow()) {
565     this.repaint();
566   }
567   
568   if (loopCount >= maxLoopCount) {
569     try {
570       console.log('Warning: maximum number of loops exceeded');
571     } catch (err) {}
572   }
573 }
574 
575 /**
576  * Get the currently visible part of the contents
577  * @return {Object} window   Object containing parameters left, top, width, height
578  */ 
579 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.getVisibleWindow = function() {
580   return this.window;
581 }
582 
583 /**
584  * Update the data of the frame
585  */ 
586 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.update = function() {
587   if (this.grid) {
588     this.grid.update();
589   }
590 }
591 
592 /**
593  * Update the currently visible window.
594  */ 
595 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype._updateVisibleWindow = function () {
596   var grid = this.grid,
597     frameHeight = this.frameHeight,
598     frameWidth = this.frameWidth,
599     gridTop = (grid ? grid.getTop() : 0),
600     gridHeight = (grid ? grid.getHeight() : 0),
601     scrollTop = this.verticalScroll ? this.verticalScroll.get() : 0;
602 
603   // update top position, relative on total height and scrollTop
604   if (gridHeight > 0 && frameHeight > 0 && scrollTop > 0) {
605     this.top = (gridTop + gridHeight - frameHeight) / (gridHeight - frameHeight)  * scrollTop;
606   }
607   else {
608     this.top = 0;
609   }
610 
611   // update the visible window object
612   this.window = {
613     'left': this.left,
614     'top': this.top,
615     'height': frameHeight,
616     'width': frameWidth
617   };
618 }
619 
620 /**
621  * Recalculate sizes of DOM elements 
622  * @return {Boolean} resized    true if the contents are resized, else false
623  */ 
624 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.reflow = function () {
625   //console.log('Frame.reflow');
626   var resized = false;
627   var dom = this.dom,
628     options = this.options,
629     grid = this.grid;
630 
631   if (grid) {
632     var gridResized = grid.reflow();
633     resized = resized || gridResized;
634   }
635 
636   var frameHeight = dom.mainFrame ? dom.mainFrame.clientHeight : 0;
637   var frameWidth = dom.mainFrame ? dom.mainFrame.clientWidth : 0;
638   resized = resized || (this.frameHeight != frameHeight);
639   resized = resized || (this.frameWidth != frameWidth);
640   this.frameHeight = frameHeight;
641   this.frameWidth = frameWidth;
642 
643   if (resized) {
644     this.verticalScroll.setInterval(0, this.gridHeight - frameHeight);
645     this._updateVisibleWindow();
646   }
647   this.verticalScroll.reflow();
648 
649   return resized;
650 };
651 
652 /**
653  * Update the height of this node, because a child's height has been changed.
654  * This will not cause any repaints, but just updates the height of this node.
655  * updateHeight() is called via an onUpdateHeight() from a child node.
656  * @param {links.TreeGrid.Node} child
657  * @param {Number} diffHeight     change in height
658  */ 
659 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.updateHeight = function (child, diffHeight) {
660   if (child == this.grid) {
661     this.gridHeight += diffHeight; 
662   }
663 }
664 
665 
666 /**
667  * Redraw the TreeGrid
668  * (child grids are not redrawn)
669  */ 
670 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.repaint = function() {
671   //console.log('Frame.repaint');
672   this._repaintFrame();
673   this._repaintScrollbars();
674   this._repaintGrid();
675 };
676 
677 /**
678  * Redraw the frame 
679  */ 
680 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype._repaintFrame = function() {
681   var frame = this,
682     dom = this.dom,
683     options = this.options;
684   
685   // create the main frame
686   var mainFrame = dom.mainFrame;
687   if (!mainFrame) {
688     // the surrounding main frame
689     mainFrame = document.createElement('DIV');
690     mainFrame.className = 'treegrid-frame';
691     mainFrame.style.position = 'relative';
692     mainFrame.style.overflow = 'hidden';
693     //mainFrame.style.overflow = 'visible'; // TODO: cleanup
694     mainFrame.style.left = '0px';
695     mainFrame.style.top = '0px';
696 
697     this.container.appendChild(mainFrame);
698     dom.mainFrame = mainFrame;
699 
700     links.TreeGrid.addEventListener(mainFrame, 'mousedown', 
701       function (event) {
702         frame.onMouseDown(event);
703     });
704     links.TreeGrid.addEventListener(mainFrame, 'mousewheel', 
705       function (event) {
706         frame.onMouseWheel(event);
707     });
708     links.TreeGrid.addEventListener(mainFrame, 'touchstart', 
709       function (event) {
710         frame.onTouchStart(event);
711     });
712     
713     var dragImage = document.createElement('div');
714     dragImage.innerHTML = '1 item';
715     dragImage.className = 'treegrid-drag-image';
716     this.dom.dragImage = dragImage;
717     
718     links.dnd.makeDraggable(mainFrame, {
719       'dragImage': dragImage,
720       'dragImageOffsetX': 10,
721       'dragImageOffsetY': -10,
722       'dragStart': function (event) {return frame.onDragStart(event);},
723       'dragEnd': function (event) {return frame.onDragEnd(event);}
724     });
725   }
726 
727   // resize frame
728   mainFrame.style.width = options.width  || '100%';
729   mainFrame.style.height = options.height || '100%';
730 
731   // create the frame for holding the items
732   var itemFrame = dom.itemFrame;
733   if (!itemFrame) {
734     // the surrounding main frame
735     itemFrame = document.createElement('DIV');
736     itemFrame.style.position = 'absolute';
737     itemFrame.style.left = '0px';
738     itemFrame.style.top = '0px';
739     itemFrame.style.width = '100%';
740     itemFrame.style.height = '0px';
741     dom.mainFrame.appendChild(itemFrame);
742     dom.itemFrame = itemFrame;
743   }
744 };
745 
746 /**
747  * Repaint the grid
748  */ 
749 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype._repaintGrid = function() {
750   if (this.grid) {
751     this.grid.repaint();
752   }
753 }
754 
755 /**
756  * Redraw the scrollbar
757  */ 
758 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype._repaintScrollbars = function() {
759   var dom = this.dom;
760   var scrollContainer = dom.scrollContainer;
761   if (!scrollContainer) {
762     scrollContainer = document.createElement('div');
763     scrollContainer.style.position = 'absolute';
764     scrollContainer.style.zIndex = 9999; // TODO: not so nice solution
765     scrollContainer.style.right = '0px'; // TODO: test on old IE
766     scrollContainer.style.top = '0px';
767     scrollContainer.style.height = '100%';
768     scrollContainer.style.width = '16px';
769     dom.mainFrame.appendChild(scrollContainer);
770     dom.scrollContainer = scrollContainer;
771 
772     var frame = this;
773     verticalScroll = new links.TreeGrid.VerticalScroll(scrollContainer);
774     verticalScroll.addOnChangeHandler(function (value) {
775       frame.onRangeChange();
776     });
777     this.verticalScroll = verticalScroll;
778   }
779   this.verticalScroll.redraw();
780 };

782 /**
783  * Check if given object is a Javascript Array
784  * @param {any type} obj
785  * @return {Boolean} isArray    true if the given object is an array
786  */ 
787 // See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2943805/javascript-instanceof-typeof-in-gwt-jsni
788 links.TreeGrid.isArray = function (obj) {
789   if (obj instanceof Array) {
790     return true;
791   }
792   return (Object.prototype.toString.call(obj) === '[object Array]');
793 }
794 
795 /**
796  * Grid can display one Grid, with data from one DataConnector
797  * @param {DataConnector} data      
798  * @param {Object}        options         A key-value map with options
799  */ 
800 links.TreeGrid.Grid = function (data, options) {
801   // set dataconnector
802   // TODO: add support for a google DataTable
803   
804   this.setData(data);
805 
806   this.dom = {
807   };
808 
809   // initialize options
810   this.options = {
811     'items': {
812       'defaultHeight': 24, // px
813       'minHeight': 24      // px
814     }
815   };
816   if (options) {
817     // merge options
818     links.TreeGrid.extend(this.options, options);
819   }
820   
821   this.columns = [];
822   this.itemsHeight = 0;       // Total height of all items
823   this.items = [];
824   this.itemCount = undefined; // total number of items
825   this.visibleItems = [];
826   this.expandedItems = [];
827   this.iconsWidth = 0;
828 
829   this.headerHeight = 0;
830   this.header = new links.TreeGrid.Header({'options': this.options});
831   this.header.setParent(this);
832 
833   this.loadingHeight = 0;
834   this.emptyHeight = 0;
835   this.errorHeight = 0;
836   this.height = this.options.items.defaultHeight;
837 
838   this.dropAreas = [];
839   this.dropAreaHeight = this.options.dropAreaHeight;
840 
841   // offset and limit gives the currently visible items
842   this.offset = 0;
843   this.limit = 0;
844 };
845 
846 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype = new links.TreeGrid.Node();;
847 
848 
849 /** 
850  * update the data: update items in the visible range, and update the item count 
851  */ 
852 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype.update = function() {
853   // determine the limit and offset
854   var currentRange = {
855     'offset': this.offset,
856     'limit': this.limit
857   };
858   var window = this.getVisibleWindow();
859   var newRange = this._getRangeFromWindow(window, currentRange);
860   this.offset = newRange.offset;
861   this.limit = newRange.limit;
862 
863   var grid = this,
864     items = this.items,
865     offset = this.offset,
866     limit = this.limit;
867 
868   //console.log('update', this.left, offset, offset + limit)
869 
870   // update childs of the items
871   var updateItems = links.TreeGrid.mergeArray(this.visibleItems, this.expandedItems);
872   for (var i = 0, iMax = updateItems.length; i < iMax; i++) {
873     var item = updateItems[i];
874     if (item) {
875       item.update();
876     }
877   }
878   
879   var changeCallback = function (changedItems) {
880     //console.log('changesCallback', changedItems, newOffset, newLimit);
881     grid.error = undefined;
882     grid._updateItems(offset, limit);
883   };
884   
885   var changeErrback = function (err) {
886     grid.error = err;
887   }
888   
889   // update the items. on callback, load all uninitialized and changed items
890   this._getChanges(offset, limit, changeCallback, changeErrback);
891 }
892 
893 
894 /**
895  * Update the height of this grid, because a child's height has been changed.
896  * This will not cause any repaints, but just updates the height of this node.
897  * updateHeight() is called via an onUpdateHeight() from a child node.
898  * @param {links.TreeGrid.Node} child
899  * @param {Number} diffHeight     change in height
900  */ 
901 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype.updateHeight = function (child, diffHeight) {
902   var index = -1;
903 
904   if (child instanceof links.TreeGrid.Header) {
905     this.headerHeight += diffHeight; 
906     index = -1;
907   }
908   else if (child instanceof links.TreeGrid.Item) {
909     this.itemsHeight += diffHeight; 
910     index = this.items.indexOf(child);
911   }
912 
913   // move all lower down items
914   var items = this.items;
915   for (var i = index + 1, iMax = items.length; i < iMax; i++) {
916     var item = items[i];
917     if (item) {
918       item.top += diffHeight;
919     }
920   }
921 }

923 /**
924  * Event handler for drop event
925  */ 
926 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype.onDrop = function(event) {
927   var data = JSON.parse(event.dataTransfer.getData('text'));
928 
929   // TODO: trigger event?
930   
931   if (this.dataConnector) {
932     var me = this;
933     var callback = function () {
934       /* TODO
935       if (me.expanded) {      
936         me.onResize();
937       }
938       else {
939         me.onExpand();
940       }*/
941     }
942     var errback = callback;
943     
944     var items = [data.item];
945     if (event.dataTransfer.dropEffect == 'move') { 
946       this.dataConnector.appendItems(items, callback, errback);
947     }
948     else if (event.dataTransfer.dropEffect == 'copy') {
949       this.dataConnector.appendItems(items, callback, errback);
950     }
951     /* TODO
952     else if (event.dataTransfer.dropEffect == 'link') {
953       // TODO: should be used to link one item to another item...
954     }
955     else {
956       // TODO
957     }*/
958   }
959   else {
960     console.log('dropped but do nothing', event.dataTransfer.dropEffect);
961   }
962 
963   links.TreeGrid.preventDefault(event);
964 }

967 /**
968  * merge two arrays
969  * returns a copy of the merged arrays, containing only distinct elements 
970  */ 
971 links.TreeGrid.mergeArray = function(array1, array2) {
972   var merged = array1.slice(0); // copy first array
973   for (var i = 0, iMax = array2.length; i < iMax; i++) {
974     var elem = array2[i];
975     if (array1.indexOf(elem) == -1) {
976       merged.push(elem);
977     }
978   }
979   return merged;
980 }
981 
982 
983 /**
984  * Recalculate the size of all elements in the Grid (the width and 
985  * height of header, items, fields)
986  * @return {Boolean} resized    True if some elements are resized
987  *                              In that case, a redraw is required
988  */ 
989 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype.reflow = function() {
990   var resized = false,
991     visibleItems = this.visibleItems;
992 
993   // preform a reflow on all childs (the header, visible items, expanded items)
994   if (this.header) {
995     var headerResized = this.header.reflow();
996     resized = resized || headerResized;
997   }
998 
999   var reflowItems = links.TreeGrid.mergeArray(this.visibleItems, this.expandedItems);
1000   for (var i = 0, iMax = reflowItems.length; i < iMax; i++) {  
1001     var item = reflowItems[i];
1002     if (item) {
1003       var itemResized = item.reflow();
1004       resized = resized || itemResized;
1005     }
1006   }
1007   
1008   // reflow for all drop areas
1009   var dropAreas = this.dropAreas;
1010   for (var i = 0, iMax = dropAreas.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1011     dropAreas[i].reflow();
1012   }
1013 
1014   // calculate the width of the fields of the header
1015   var widths = this.header.getFieldWidths();
1016   var columns = this.columns,
1017     indentationWidth = this.options.indentationWidth;
1018   for (var i = 0, iMax = widths.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1019     var column = columns[i];
1020     if (!column.fixedWidth) {
1021       var width = widths[i] + indentationWidth;
1022       if (width > column.width) {
1023         column.width = width;
1024         resized = true;
1025       }
1026     }
1027   }
1028 
1029   // calculate the width of the fields
1030   for (var i = 0, iMax = visibleItems.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1031     var item = visibleItems[i];
1032     var offset = 0;
1033     var widths = item.getFieldWidths();
1034     for (var j = 0, jMax = columns.length; j < jMax; j++) {
1035       var column = columns[j];
1036       
1037       if (!column.fixedWidth) {
1038         var width = widths[j] + indentationWidth;
1039         if (width > column.width) {
1040           column.width = width;
1041           resized = true;
1042         }
1043       }
1044     }
1045   }
1046 
1047   // calculate the width of the icons
1048   if (this.isVisible()) {
1049     var iconsWidth = 0;
1050     for (var i = 0, iMax = visibleItems.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1051       var item = visibleItems[i];
1052       var width = item.getIconsWidth();
1053       iconsWidth = Math.max(width, iconsWidth);
1054     }
1055     if (this.iconsWidth != iconsWidth) {
1056       resized = true;
1057     }
1058     this.iconsWidth = iconsWidth;
1059   }
1060   
1061   // calculate the left postions of the columns
1062   var left = indentationWidth + this.iconsWidth;
1063   for (var i = 0, iMax = columns.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1064     var column = columns[i];
1065     column.left = left;
1066     left += column.width;
1067   }
1068 
1069   // calculate the width of the grid in total
1070   var width = 0;
1071   if (columns && columns.length) {
1072     var lastColumn = columns[columns.length - 1];
1073     var width = lastColumn.left + lastColumn.width;
1074   }
1075   resized = resized || (width != this.width);
1076   this.width = width;
1077   
1078   // update the height of loading message
1079   if (this.loading) {
1080     if (this.dom.loading) {
1081       this.loadingHeight = this.dom.loading.clientHeight;
1082     }
1083     else {
1084       // leave the height as it is
1085     }
1086   }
1087   else {
1088     this.loadingHeight = 0;
1089   }
1090 
1091   // update the height of error message
1092   if (this.error) {
1093     if (this.dom.error) {
1094       this.errorHeight = this.dom.error.clientHeight;
1095     }
1096     else {
1097       // leave the height as it is
1098     }
1099   }
1100   else {
1101     this.errorHeight = 0;
1102   }
1103 
1104   // update the height of empty message
1105   if (this.itemCount == 0) {
1106     if (this.dom.empty) {
1107       this.emptyHeight = this.dom.empty.clientHeight;
1108     }
1109     else {
1110       // leave the height as it is
1111     }
1112   }
1113   else {
1114     this.emptyHeight = 0;
1115   }
1116   
1117   // calculate the total height
1118   var height = 0;
1119   height += this.headerHeight;
1120   height += this.itemsHeight;
1121   height += this.loadingHeight;
1122   height += this.emptyHeight;
1123   //height += this.errorHeight; // We do not append the height of the error to the total height.
1124   if (height == 0) {
1125     // grid can never have zero height, should always contain some message
1126     height = this.options.items.defaultHeight;
1127   }
1128   
1129   var diffHeight = (height - this.height);
1130   if (diffHeight) {
1131     resized = true;
1132     this.height = height;
1133     this.onUpdateHeight(diffHeight);
1134   }
1135 
1136   return resized;
1137 };

1140 /**
1141  * Redraw the grid
1142  * this will recursively the header, the items, and the childs of items
1143  */ 
1144 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype.repaint = function() {
1145   //console.log('repaint');
1146   
1147   var grid = this,
1148     dom = grid.dom;
1149 
1150   this._repaintLoading();
1151   this._repaintEmpty();
1152   this._repaintError();
1153   this._repaintHeader();
1154   this._repaintItems();
1155   
1156   /* TODO: dropareas
1157   this._repaintDropAreas();
1158   */
1159   
1160   window.count = window.count ? window.count + 1 : 1; // TODO: cleanup
1161 };
1162 
1163 /**
1164  * Redraw a "loading" text when the grid is uninitialized
1165  */ 
1166 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype._repaintLoading = function() {
1167   //console.log('repaintLoading', this.left, this.isVisible(), this.loading); // TODO: cleanup
1168 
1169   // redraw loading icon
1170   if (this.isVisible() && this.itemCount == undefined && !this.error) {
1171     var domLoadingIcon = this.dom.loadingIcon;
1172     if (!domLoadingIcon) {
1173       // create loading icon
1174       domLoadingIcon = document.createElement('DIV');
1175       domLoadingIcon.className = 'treegrid-loading-icon';
1176       domLoadingIcon.style.position = 'absolute';
1177       //domLoadingIcon.style.zIndex = 9999; // TODO: loading icon of the Grid always on top?
1178       domLoadingIcon.title = 'refreshing...';
1179 
1180       this.getContainer().appendChild(domLoadingIcon);
1181       this.dom.loadingIcon = domLoadingIcon;
1182     }
1183 
1184     // position the loading icon
1185     domLoadingIcon.style.top = Math.max(this.getAbsTop(), 0) + 'px';
1186     domLoadingIcon.style.left = this.getAbsLeft() + 'px';
1187   }
1188   else {
1189     if (this.dom.loadingIcon) {
1190       this.dom.loadingIcon.parentNode.removeChild(this.dom.loadingIcon);
1191       this.dom.loadingIcon = undefined;
1192     }
1193   }
1194 
1195   // redraw loading text
1196   if (this.isVisible() && !this.error && this.itemCount == undefined) {
1197     var domLoadingText = this.dom.loadingText;
1198     if (!domLoadingText) {
1199       // create a "loading..." text
1200       var domLoadingText = document.createElement('div');
1201       domLoadingText.className = 'treegrid-loading';
1202       domLoadingText.style.position = 'absolute';
1203       domLoadingText.appendChild(document.createTextNode('loading...'));
1204       this.getContainer().appendChild(domLoadingText);
1205       this.dom.loadingText = domLoadingText;
1206     }
1207 
1208     // position the loading text
1209     domLoadingText.style.top = Math.max(this.getAbsTop(), 0) + 'px';
1210     domLoadingText.style.left = this.getAbsLeft() + this.options.indentationWidth + 'px';
1211   }
1212   else {
1213     if (this.dom.loadingText) {
1214       delete this.loadingHeight;
1215 
1216       this.dom.loadingText.parentNode.removeChild(this.dom.loadingText);
1217       this.dom.loadingText = undefined;
1218     }
1219   }
1220 };
1221 
1222 /**
1223  * Redraw a "(empty)" text when the grid container zero items
1224  */ 
1225 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype._repaintEmpty = function() {
1226   var dom = this.dom;
1227   
1228   if (this.itemCount == 0 && this.isVisible()) {
1229     var domEmpty = dom.empty;
1230     if (!domEmpty) {
1231       // draw a "empty" text
1232       domEmpty = document.createElement('div');
1233       domEmpty.className = 'treegrid-loading';
1234       domEmpty.style.position = 'absolute';
1235       domEmpty.appendChild(document.createTextNode('(empty)'));
1236       this.getContainer().appendChild(domEmpty);
1237       dom.empty = domEmpty;
1238 
1239       var item = this.parent;
1240       var dataTransfer = item.dataConnector ? item.dataConnector.getOptions().dataTransfer : undefined;
1241       if (dataTransfer) {
1242         links.dnd.makeDroppable(domEmpty, {
1243           'dropEffect': dataTransfer.dropEffect,
1244           'drop': function (event) {item.onDrop(event);},
1245           'dragEnter': function (event) {item.onDragEnter(event);},
1246           'dragOver': function (event) {item.onDragOver(event);},
1247           'dragLeave': function (event) {item.onDragLeave(event);}
1248         });
1249       }    
1250     }
1251     
1252     // position the empty text
1253     domEmpty.style.top = Math.max(this.getAbsTop(), 0) + 'px';
1254     domEmpty.style.left = this.getAbsLeft() + this.options.indentationWidth + 'px';        
1255     domEmpty.style.width = (this.parent.width - 2 * this.options.indentationWidth) + 'px'; // TODO: not so nice... use real width        
1256   }
1257   else {
1258     if (dom.empty) {
1259       links.dnd.removeDroppable(domEmpty);
1260       
1261       dom.empty.parentNode.removeChild(dom.empty);
1262       delete this.dom.empty;
1263     }
1264   }
1265 };
1266 
1267 /**
1268  * Redraw an error message (if any)
1269  */ 
1270 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype._repaintError = function() {
1271   var dom = this.dom;
1272   
1273   if (this.isVisible() && this.error) {
1274     var domError = dom.error;
1275     if (!domError) {
1276       // draw a "loading..." text
1277       var domError = document.createElement('div');
1278       domError.className = 'treegrid-error';
1279       domError.style.position = 'absolute';
1280       domError.appendChild(document.createTextNode('Error: ' + 
1281         links.TreeGrid.Grid._errorToString(this.error)));
1282       this.getContainer().appendChild(domError);
1283       dom.error = domError;
1284     }
1285     
1286     // position the error message
1287     domError.style.top = Math.max(this.getAbsTop(), 0) + 'px';
1288     domError.style.left = this.getAbsLeft() + this.options.indentationWidth + 'px';    
1289   }
1290   else {
1291     if (dom.error) {
1292       dom.error.parentNode.removeChild(dom.error);
1293       dom.error = undefined;
1294     }
1295   }
1296 
1297   // redraw error icon
1298   if (this.isVisible() && this.error && !this.loading) {
1299     var domErrorIcon = this.dom.errorIcon;
1300     if (!domErrorIcon) {
1301       // create error icon
1302       domErrorIcon = document.createElement('DIV');
1303       domErrorIcon.className = 'treegrid-error-icon';
1304       domErrorIcon.style.position = 'absolute';
1305       domErrorIcon.title = this.error;
1306 
1307       this.getContainer().appendChild(domErrorIcon);
1308       this.dom.errorIcon = domErrorIcon;
1309     }
1310 
1311     // position the error icon
1312     var absLeft = this.getAbsLeft();
1313     domErrorIcon.style.top = Math.max(this.getAbsTop(), 0) + 'px';
1314     domErrorIcon.style.left = absLeft + 'px';
1315     domErrorIcon.style.zIndex = absLeft + 1;
1316   }
1317   else {
1318     if (this.dom.errorIcon) {
1319       this.dom.errorIcon.parentNode.removeChild(this.dom.errorIcon);
1320       this.dom.errorIcon = undefined;
1321     }
1322   }
1323 };

1326 /**
1327  * Retrieve the available columns from the given fields
1328  * @param {Object} fields     example object containing field names/values
1329  */ 
1330 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype.getColumnsFromFields = function (fields) {
1331   var columns = [];
1332   if (fields) {
1333     var i = 0;
1334     for (var fieldName in fields) {
1335       if (fields.hasOwnProperty(fieldName)) {
1336         var field = fields[fieldName];
1337         if (fieldName.charAt(0) != '_' && !links.TreeGrid.isArray(field) &&
1338              !(field instanceof links.DataConnector)) {
1339           var column = {
1340             'name': fieldName
1341           }
1342           columns[i] = column;
1343           i++;
1344         }
1345       }
1346     }
1347   }
1348   return columns;
1349 };
1350 
1351 
1352 /**
1353  * Update the columns of the header
1354  * @param {Array with Objects} columns   Column names and additional information
1355  *                                       The object contains parameters 'name',
1356  *                                       and optionally 'text', 'title'
1357  */ 
1358 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype.setColumns = function (columns) {
1359   var indentationWidth = this.options.indentationWidth;
1360   var newColumns = [];
1361   var changed = false;
1362   
1363   // console.log('setColumns start', columns, this.columns, indentationWidth);
1364   
1365   for (var i = 0, iMax = columns.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1366     var curColumn = this.columns[i];
1367     var column = columns[i];
1368     
1369     // check for changes in the fields
1370     if (!curColumn) {
1371       changed = true;
1372     }
1373     if (!changed) {
1374       for (field in column) {
1375         if (curColumn[field] != column[field]) {
1376           changed = true;
1377           break;
1378         }
1379       }
1380     }
1381     if (!changed) {
1382       for (field in curColumn) {
1383         if (field != 'width' && 
1384             field != 'left' && 
1385             curColumn[field] != column[field]) {
1386           changed = true;
1387           break;
1388         }
1389       }
1390     }
1391 
1392     // create a new column object
1393     var newColumn = {
1394       'name': '',
1395       'width': 0,
1396       'left': 0
1397     };
1398 
1399     // copy width from current column
1400     if (!changed && curColumn) {
1401       if (curColumn.width != undefined) {
1402         newColumn.width = curColumn.width;
1403       }
1404       if (curColumn.left != undefined) {
1405         newColumn.left = curColumn.left;
1406       }
1407     }
1408 
1409     // set a fixed width if applicable
1410     newColumn.fixedWidth = (column.width != undefined);
1411 
1412     // copy values from new column data
1413     for (field in column) {
1414       newColumn[field] = column[field];
1415     }
1416     
1417     // store the new colum fields
1418     this.columns[i] = newColumn;
1419     newColumns[i] = newColumn;
1420   }
1421 
1422   if (this.columns.length != columns.length) {
1423     changed = true;
1424   }
1425   
1426   if (changed) {
1427     // replace the contents of columns array.
1428     // Important: keep the same array object, all items link to this object!
1429     this.columns.splice(0, this.columns.length); 
1430     for (var i = 0; i < newColumns.length; i++) {
1431       this.columns.push(newColumns[i]);
1432     }
1433     //console.log('columns changed!');
1434   }
1435   //console.log('setColumns end', this.columns);
1436 }
1437 
1438 /**
1439  * Set or change the data or dataconnector for the grid
1440  * @param {Array or DataConnector} data
1441  */ 
1442 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype.setData = function (data) {
1443   var changed = (data != this.data);
1444 
1445   if (changed) {
1446     // create new data connector
1447     var dataConnector;
1448     if (links.TreeGrid.isArray(data)) {
1449       dataConnector = new links.DataTable(data);
1450     }
1451     else if (data instanceof links.DataConnector) {
1452       dataConnector = data;
1453     }
1454     else {
1455       throw 'Error: no valid data. JSON Array or DataConnector expected.';
1456     }
1457 
1458     // clean up old data connector
1459     if (this.dataConnector && this.eventListener) {
1460       this.dataConnector.removeEventListener(this.eventListener);
1461       this.eventListener = undefined;
1462       this.dataConnector = undefined;
1463       
1464       // cleanup data
1465       var items = this.items;
1466       for (var i = 0, iMax = this.items.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1467         var item = items[i];
1468         if (item) {
1469           item.data = undefined;
1470         }
1471       }
1472     }
1473     
1474     var grid = this;
1475     this.eventListener = function (event, params) {
1476       if (event == 'change') {
1477         grid.update();
1478       }
1479     }
1480     
1481     // store and link the new dataconnector
1482     // TODO: use the eventbus instead of the addEventListener structure?
1483     this.dataConnector = dataConnector;
1484     this.dataConnector.addEventListener(this.eventListener);
1485     
1486     if (this.dataConnector && this.dataConnector.options.showHeader != undefined) {
1487       this.showHeader = this.dataConnector.options.showHeader;
1488     }
1489     else {
1490       this.showHeader = true;
1491     }
1492   }
1493 }
1494 /**
1495  * Remove the item at given index
1496  * all lower down items will be shifted one up. These changes take only
1497  * place in the display of the treegrid, and are not refected to a dataconnector
1498  * @param {Number} index
1499  */ 
1500 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype._removeItem = function (item) {
1501   var items = this.items;
1502   var index = items.indexOf(item);
1503   if (index != -1) {
1504     if (item.expanded) {
1505       item.onExpand();
1506     }
1507     
1508     var visIndex = this.visibleItems.indexOf(item);
1509     if (visIndex != -1) {
1510       this.visibleItems.splice(visIndex, 1);
1511     }
1512     
1513     var height = item.getHeight();
1514     this.updateHeight(item, -height);
1515     item.hide();
1516     items.splice(index, 1);
1517     this.itemCount--;
1518   }
1519 }
1520 
1521 /**
1522  * Update the columns of the header
1523  * @param {Array with Objects} columns
1524  */ 
1525 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype._updateHeader = function (columns) {
1526   this.header.setFields(columns);
1527 }
1528 
1529 /**
1530  * Get the items which are changed, and give them a status dirty=true.
1531  * After that, the changed items may be retrieved
1532  * @param {Number} offset
1533  * @param {Number} limit
1534  * @param {function} callback.  Called with the array containing the changed
1535  *                              items as first parameter. Note that the items
1536  *                              themselves are not yet updated!
1537  * @param {function} errback
1538  */ 
1539 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype._getChanges = function (offset, limit, callback, errback) {
1540   var grid = this;
1541   //console.log('_getChanges', offset, limit)
1542  
1543   // create a list with items to be checked for changes
1544   // only check items when they are not already checked for changes
1545   var checkData = [];
1546   var checkItemIds = [];
1547   for (var i = offset, iMax = offset + limit; i < iMax; i++) {
1548     var item = this.getItem(i);
1549     checkData.push(item.data);
1550     checkItemIds.push(i);
1551   }
1552   
1553   var changesCallback = function (resp) {
1554     var changedItems = resp.items || [];
1555     var itemsChanged = (checkData.length < limit || changedItems.length > 0 );
1556 
1557     //console.log('changesCallback', resp.totalItems, resp.items);
1558 
1559     // update the item count
1560     var countChanged = (resp.totalItems !== grid.itemCount);
1561     if (countChanged) {
1562       /* TODO
1563       if (grid.totalItems !== undefined || resp.totalItems !== 0) { 
1564         // On the first run, grid.totalItems will be undefined. When getChanges
1565         // in that case returns resp.totalItems==0, we do not set the totalItems 
1566         // here but leave it undefined, forcing a call of getItems.
1567         grid.setItemCount(resp.totalItems);
1568       }*/
1569       grid.setItemCount(resp.totalItems);
1570     }
1571     
1572     // give changed items a 'dirty' status, and unmark the items from their updating status
1573     for (var i = offset, iMax = offset + limit; i < iMax; i++) {
1574       var item = grid.getItem(i);
1575       item.updating = false;
1576     
1577       if (!item.data || changedItems.indexOf(item.data) != -1) {
1578         item.dirty = true;
1579       }
1580 
1581       //console.log('changesCallback', i, item.dirty, changedItems.indexOf(item.data), item.data);
1582     }
1583     
1584     //console.log('changesCallback item[0].updating=', grid.getItem(0).updating);
1585     
1586     if (countChanged || itemsChanged) {
1587       //console.log('there are changes or dirty items');
1588       grid.onResize();
1589     }
1590     
1591     if (callback) {
1592       callback(changedItems);
1593     }
1594   }
1595   
1596   var changesErrback = function (err) {
1597     for (var i = offset, iMax = offset + limit; i < iMax; i++) {
1598       var item = grid.getItem(i);
1599       item.error = err;
1600       item.updating = false;
1601       item.dirty = true;
1602     }
1603     
1604     grid.onResize();
1605     
1606     if (errback) {
1607       errback(err);
1608     }
1609   }
1610 
1611   //console.log('_getChanges', offset, limit, checkData, checkItemIds)
1612 
1613   // mark the items as updating
1614   for (var i = 0, iMax = checkItemIds.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1615     var id = checkItemIds[i];
1616     this.items[id].updating = true;
1617   }
1618   
1619   // check for changes in the items
1620   // Note: we always check for changes, also if checkData.length==0,
1621   //       because we want to retrieve the item count too
1622   this.dataConnector.getChanges(offset, limit, checkData, changesCallback, changesErrback); 
1623 }
1624 
1625 /**
1626  * Retrieve the items in the range of current window
1627  * @param {Number} offset
1628  * @param {Number} limit
1629  * @param {function} callback
1630  * @param {function} errback
1631  * @return {Boolean} updating      true if items are being updated
1632  */ 
1633 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype._updateItems = function (offset, limit, callback, errback) {
1634   var grid = this,
1635     items = this.items;
1636 
1637   // first minimize the range of items to be retrieved: 
1638   // limit to:
1639   // - dirty items 
1640   // - not loaded items
1641   // - items not being loaded
1642   // TODO: optimize this, do not search twice for the same item (by calling .getItem())
1643   var item = this.getItem(offset);
1644   while (limit > 0 && (item.loading || (!item.dirty && item.data))) {
1645     offset++;
1646     limit--;
1647     item = this.getItem(offset);
1648   }
1649   item = this.getItem(offset + limit - 1);
1650   //while (limit > 0 && item.data && !item.dirty) {
1651   while (limit > 0 && (item.loading || (!item.dirty && item.data))) {
1652     limit--;
1653     item = this.getItem(offset + limit - 1);
1654   }
1655 
1656   // mark all items which are going to be loaded as "loading" and "dirty"
1657   for (var i = offset, iMax = offset + limit; i < iMax; i++) {
1658     var item = this.getItem(i);
1659     if (item.error || item.dirty || !item.data) {
1660       item.loading = true;
1661       item.dirty = true;
1662     }
1663   }
1664 
1665   var getItemsCallback = function (resp) {
1666     //console.log('items retrieved', offset, limit, resp);
1667     var newItems = resp.items;
1668 
1669     // set the loaded items to not-loading
1670     for (var i = offset, iMax = offset + limit; i < iMax; i++) {
1671       var item = grid.getItem(i);
1672       item.loading = false;
1673       item.dirty = false;
1674     }
1675 
1676     // update the new items
1677     if (newItems.length) {
1678       var columns = grid.dataConnector.getOptions().columns || grid.getColumnsFromFields(newItems[0]);
1679       grid.setColumns(columns);
1680       grid._updateHeader(grid.columns);
1681     }
1682     
1683     // store the new items 
1684     for (var i = 0, iMax = newItems.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1685       var data = newItems[i];
1686       if (data) {
1687         var index = offset + i;
1688         var item = grid.getItem(index);
1689         item.data = data;
1690         item.setFields(data, grid.columns);
1691         item.error = undefined;
1692       }
1693     }
1694 
1695     grid.onResize();
1696       
1697     if (callback) {
1698       callback();
1699     }
1700   }
1701 
1702   var getItemsErrback = function (err) {
1703     // set all items to error
1704     for (var i = offset, iMax = offset + limit; i < iMax; i++) {
1705       var item = grid.getItem(i);
1706       item.loading = false;
1707       item.dirty = true;
1708       item.error = err;
1709     }
1710     
1711     grid.onResize();
1712     
1713     if (errback) {
1714       errback(err);
1715     }
1716   }
1717 
1718   if (limit > 0 || this.totalItems === undefined) {
1719     //console.log('_updateItems offset=' + offset + ', limit=' + limit ); // TODO: cleanup
1720 
1721     this.repaint();
1722     this.dataConnector.getItems(offset, limit, getItemsCallback, getItemsErrback);
1723   }
1724   else  {
1725     if (callback) {
1726       callback();
1727     }
1728   } 
1729 };
1730

1732 /**
1733  * Redraw the header
1734  */ 
1735 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype._repaintHeader = function () {
1736   var visible = (this.showHeader && this.itemCount != undefined && this.itemCount > 0);
1737   this.header.setVisible(visible);
1738   this.header.repaint();
1739 }
1740 
1741 /**
1742  * Redraw the items in the currently visible window
1743  */ 
1744 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype._repaintItems = function () {
1745   var columns = this.columns,
1746     windowTop = (this.window && this.window.top) ? this.window.top : 0,
1747     visibleItems = this.visibleItems;
1748 
1749   // remove items which are outside the visible window
1750   var visible = this.isVisible(),
1751     visibleItems = this.visibleItems,
1752     i = 0;
1753   while (i < visibleItems.length) {
1754     var item = visibleItems[i];
1755     if (item.index < this.offset || item.index >= this.offset + this.limit || !visible) {
1756       item.hide();
1757       var index = visibleItems.indexOf(item);
1758       if (index != -1) {
1759         visibleItems.splice(index, 1);
1760         i--;
1761       }
1762     }
1763     i++;
1764   }
1765 
1766   // add items inside the visible window
1767   var itemCount = this.itemCount || 0,
1768     iStart = this.offset,
1769     iEnd = Math.min(this.offset + this.limit, itemCount);
1770   if (this.isVisible()) {
1771     for (var i = iStart; i < iEnd; i++) {
1772       var item = this.getItem(i);
1773       item.setVisible(true);
1774       if (visibleItems.indexOf(item) == -1) {
1775         visibleItems.push(item);
1776       }
1777     }
1778   }
1779 
1780   // repaint the visible items
1781   for (var i = 0; i < visibleItems.length; i++) {
1782     var item = visibleItems[i];
1783     item.repaint();
1784   }
1785 };
1786 
1787 /**
1788  * Redraw the dropareas between the items
1789  */ 
1790 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype._repaintDropAreas = function () {
1791   var dropEffect = 'none';
1792   if (this.dataConnector && 
1793       this.dataConnector.options && 
1794       this.dataConnector.options.dataTransfer &&
1795       this.dataConnector.options.dataTransfer.dropEffect) {
1796     dropEffect = this.dataConnector.options.dataTransfer.dropEffect;
1797   }
1798   
1799   if (dropEffect != 'none' && this.isVisible()) {
1800     var itemCount = this.itemCount || 0,
1801       iStart = this.offset,
1802       iEnd = Math.min(this.offset + this.limit, itemCount),
1803       dropAreas = this.dropAreas,
1804       dropAreaHeight = this.dropAreaHeight,
1805       container = this.getContainer();
1806 
1807     // create one droparea for each of the currently visible items
1808     var missingCount = this.limit - dropAreas.length;
1809     var redundantCount = -missingCount;
1810     for (var i = 0; i < missingCount; i++) {
1811       var dropArea = new links.TreeGrid.DropArea({
1812         'dataConnector': this.dataConnector,
1813         'item': this.getItem(this.offset + i),
1814         'height': dropAreaHeight
1815       });
1816       dropArea.setParent(this);
1817       dropAreas.push(dropArea);
1818     }
1819     for (var i = 0; i < redundantCount; i++) {
1820       var dropArea = dropAreas.shift();
1821       dropArea.hide();
1822     }
1823 
1824     // position the dropareas right above the items
1825     for (var i = iStart; i < iEnd; i++) {
1826       var item = this.getItem(i);
1827       //var itemTop = item.getAbsTop();
1828       var dropArea = dropAreas[i - this.offset];
1829       dropArea.setTop(item.top - dropAreaHeight);
1830       dropArea.item = item;
1831       dropArea.repaint();
1832     }
1833   }
1834   else {
1835     var dropAreas = this.dropAreas;
1836     while (dropAreas.length > 0) {
1837       var dropArea = dropAreas.shift();
1838       dropArea.hide();
1839     }
1840   }
1841 }

1851     this.options = params.options;

1853   
1854   this.fieldsHeight = 0;
1855   
1856   // data
1857   this.dom = {};
1858   this.columns = undefined;
1859 }

1868   this.columns = undefined;
1869   this.fieldsHeight = 0;
1870 }

1873 /**
1874  * Redraw the header of the grid
1875  */ 
1876 links.TreeGrid.Header.prototype.repaint = function () {
1877   if (this.isVisible() && this.columns) {
1878     // check if the columns are changed
1879     var columns = this.columns;
1880     var prevColumns = this.prevColumns;
1881     if (columns != prevColumns) {
1882       // columns are changed. remove old dom
1883       this.hide();
1884       this.prevColumns = columns;
1885     }
1886 
1887     var domHeader = this.dom.header;
1888     if (!domHeader) {
1889       // create the DOM
1890       domHeader = document.createElement('DIV');
1891       domHeader.treeGridType = 'header';
1892       domHeader.className = 'treegrid-header';
1893       domHeader.style.position = 'absolute';
1894       domHeader.style.zIndex = 1 + this.getAbsLeft(); // TODO: not so nice to use zIndex and the abs left. use a subgrid level?
1895       this.getContainer().appendChild(domHeader);
1896       this.dom.header = domHeader;
1897       this.dom.fields = [];
1898       
1899       if (this.columns) {
1900         // create fields
1901         var columns = this.columns,
1902           padding = this.options.padding;
1903         for (var i = 0, iMax = columns.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1904           if (!this.dom.fields[i]) {
1905             var column = this.columns[i];
1906             var domField = document.createElement('DIV');
1907             domField.className = 'treegrid-header-field';
1908             domField.style.position = 'absolute';
1909             domField.style.top = '0px';
1910             domField.innerHTML = column.text || column.name || '';
1911             domField.title = column.title || '';
1912             domHeader.appendChild(domField);
1913 
1914             this.dom.fields[i] = domField;
1915           }
1916         }
1917       }
1918     }
1919 
1920     // reposition the header
1921     var absTop = Math.max(this.getAbsTop(), 0);
1922     domHeader.style.top = absTop + 'px';
1923     domHeader.style.left = this.getAbsLeft() + 'px';
1924     domHeader.style.height = this.height + 'px';
1925     domHeader.style.width = this.width + 'px';
1926     
1927     /* TODO: width of the header?
1928     if (this.left) {
1929       var lastColumn = this.columns[this.columns.length-1];
1930       header.dom.style.width = lastColumn.left+ lastColumn.width + 'px';
1931     }
1932     else {
1933       header.dom.style.width = '100%';
1934     }*/
1935 
1936     // position the columns
1937     var domFields = this.dom.fields;
1938     var columns = this.columns;
1939     for (var i = 0, iMax = domFields.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1940       domFields[i].style.left = columns[i].left + 'px';
1941     }
1942   }
1943   else {
1944     // not visible. 
1945     // remove the header DOM
1946     if (this.dom.header) {
1947       this.dom.header.parentNode.removeChild(this.dom.header);
1948       this.dom.header = undefined;
1949       this.dom.fields = undefined;
1950     }
1951   }
1952 };
1953 
1954 /**
1955  * Recalculate the size of the DOM elements of the header
1956  * @return {Boolean} resized
1957  */  
1958 links.TreeGrid.Header.prototype.reflow = function () {
1959   var resized = false;
1960   
1961   // calculate maximum height of the fields
1962   var domFields = this.dom ? this.dom.fields : undefined,
1963     fieldCount = domFields ? domFields.length : 0,
1964     fieldsHeight = this.options.items.minHeight;
1965   if (domFields) {
1966     for (var i = 0; i < fieldCount; i++) {
1967       if (domFields[i]) {
1968         fieldsHeight = Math.max(fieldsHeight, domFields[i].clientHeight);
1969       }
1970     }
1971     this.fieldsHeight = fieldsHeight;
1972   }
1973   else if (!this.columns) {
1974     // zero fields available, reset the fieldsHeight 
1975     this.fieldsHeight = 0;
1976   }
1977   else {
1978     // leave fieldsHeight as it is...
1979   }
1980   
1981   /* TODO: needed for auto sizing with
1982   // calculate the width of the header
1983   var contentWidth = 0;
1984   var lastColumn = this.columns ? this.columns[this.columns.length - 1] : undefined;
1985   if (lastColumn) {
1986     contentWidth = lastColumn.left + lastColumn.width;
1987   }
1988   resized = resized || (this.contentWidth != contentWidth);
1989   this.contentWidth = contentWidth;
1990   */
1991   this.width = this.getVisibleWindow().width - this.getAbsLeft();
1992   
1993   // calculate total height
1994   var height = 0;
1995   height += this.fieldsHeight;
1996   
1997   var diffHeight = (height - this.height);
1998   if  (diffHeight) {
1999     resized = true;
2000     this.height = height;
2001     this.onUpdateHeight(diffHeight);
2002   }
2003   
2004   return resized;
2005 }

2011  */

2013   if (columns) {
2014     this.columns = columns;
2015   }

2018 /**
2019  * Calculate the width of the fields from the HTML DOM
2020  * @return {Array with Numbers} widths
2021  */ 
2022 links.TreeGrid.Header.prototype.getFieldWidths = function () {
2023   var widths = [];
2024 
2025   if (this.dom.fields) {
2026     var fields = this.dom.fields;
2027     for (var i = 0, iMax = fields.length; i < iMax; i++) {
2028       widths[i] = fields[i].clientWidth;
2029     }      
2030   }
2031 
2032   return widths;
2033 }

2036 /**
2037  * Set the number of items
2038  * @param {Number} itemCount
2039  */ 
2040 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype.setItemCount = function (itemCount) {
2041   var defaultHeight = this.options.items.defaultHeight;
2042   var diff = (itemCount - (this.itemCount || 0));
2043   
2044   //console.log('setItemCount', this.itemCount, itemCount);
2045   
2046   if (diff > 0) {
2047     // items added
2048     var diffHeight = (defaultHeight + this.dropAreaHeight) * diff;
2049     this.itemsHeight += diffHeight;
2050   }
2051   
2052   if (diff < 0) {
2053     // there are items removed
2054     var oldItemCount = this.itemCount;
2055     var items = this.items;
2056     for (var i = itemCount; i < oldItemCount; i++) {
2057       var item = items[i];
2058       if (item) {
2059         item.hide();
2060         delete items[i];
2061       }
2062       var itemHeight = item ? item.getHeight() : defaultHeight;
2063       this.itemsHeight -= (itemHeight + this.dropAreaHeight);
2064     }
2065     
2066     if (itemCount == 0) {
2067       // TODO: not so nice to reset the header this way
2068       this.header.clearFields();
2069     }
2070   }
2071 
2072   this.itemCount = itemCount || 0;  
2073 };

2083   }
2084 }

2092   if (index != -1) {
2093     this.expandedItems.splice(index, 1);
2094   }

2106 /**
2107  * retrieve item at given index. If the node doesn't exist, it will be created
2108  * The node will also be created when the index is out of range
2109  * @param {Number} index
2110  * @return {links.TreeGrid.Item} item
2111  */ 
2112 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype.getItem = function (index) {
2113   var item = this.items[index];
2114 
2115   if (!item ) {
2116     // create node when not existing
2117     item = new links.TreeGrid.Item({
2118       'options': this.options, 
2119       'index': index,  // TODO: remove this index
2120       'top': this._calculateItemTop(index),
2121       'height': this.options.items.defaultHeight
2122     });
2123     item.setParent(this);
2124     this.items[index] = item;
2125   }
2126 
2127   return item;
2128 };
2129 
2130 
2131 /**
2132  * Calculate the top of an item, by calculating the bottom of the 
2133  * previous item .
2134  * This method is used when an items top and height are still undefined
2135  * @param {Number} index
2136  * @return {Number} top
2137  */
2138 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype._calculateItemTop = function(index) {
2139   var items = this.items,
2140     defaultHeight = this.options.items.defaultHeight,
2141     prevBottom = 0,
2142     prev = undefined;
2143 
2144   // find the last defined item before this item
2145   for (var i = index - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
2146     prev = items[i];
2147     if (prev && prev.top) {
2148       prevBottom += prev.top + prev.height;
2149       break;
2150     }
2151     else {
2152       prevBottom += defaultHeight;
2153     }
2154   }
2155 
2156   // use the bottom of the previous item as top, or, if none of the 
2157   // previous items is defined, just calculate based on the default height
2158   // of an item
2159   var top = (prev != undefined) ? 
2160     (prevBottom + this.dropAreaHeight) : 
2161   (this.headerHeight + defaultHeight * index + this.dropAreaHeight * (index + 1));
2162 
2163   return top;
2164 };

2167 /**
2168  * Item prototype
2169  * @param {Object} params. A key-value map containing parameters: 
2170  *                         index, top, options
2171  */ 
2172 links.TreeGrid.Item = function (params) {
2173   if (params) {
2174     this.options = params.options;
2175     this.index = params.index || 0; // TODO: remove this index
2176     this.top = params.top || 0;
2177   }
2178 
2179   // objects
2180   this.height = Math.max(this.options.items.defaultHeight, this.options.items.minHeight);
2181   this.data = undefined;    // link to the original data of this item
2182   this.fields = undefined;  // array with the fields
2183   this.fieldsHeight = 0;
2184   this.grid = undefined;
2185   this.gridHeight = 0;
2186   
2187   // status
2188   this.dirty = false;
2189   this.loading = false;
2190   this.loadingHeight = 0;
2191   this.error = undefined;
2192   this.errorheight = 0;
2193   this.dataTransfer = {}; // for drag and drop properties
2194   
2195   // html dom
2196   this.dom = {};
2197 };

2199 links.TreeGrid.Item.prototype = new links.TreeGrid.Node();;
2200 
2201 /**
2202  * Evaluate given function with a custom current object
2203  * When the given fn is a string, it will be evaluated
2204  * WARNING: evaluating fn when it is a string is unsafe. It is safer to provide
2205  *          fn as a javascript function.
2206  * @param {function or String} fn
2207  * @param {Object} obj
2208  */ 
2209 links.TreeGrid.eval = function (fn, obj) {
2210   var t = typeof(fn);
2211   if (t == 'function') { 
2212     return fn.call(obj);
2213   }
2214   else if (t == 'string') {
2215     var evalHistory = links.TreeGrid.evalHistory;
2216     if (!evalHistory) {
2217       evalHistory = {};
2218       links.TreeGrid.evalHistory = evalHistory;
2219     }
2220     
2221     var f = evalHistory[fn];
2222     if (!f) {
2223       f = eval('f=(' + fn + ');');
2224       evalHistory[fn] = f;
2225     }
2226     return f.call(obj);    
2227   }
2228   else {
2229     throw new Error('Function must be of type function or string');
2230   }
2231 }
2232 
2233 
2234 /**
2235  * read the field values from the item data
2236  * @param {Object} data     Item data
2237  * @param {Array} columns   Array with column objects, the column objects
2238  *                          contain a name, left, and width of the column
2239  */
2240 links.TreeGrid.Item.prototype.setFields = function (data, columns) {
2241   if (data && columns) {
2242     // read the field values from the columns
2243     var fields = [];
2244     for (var i = 0, iMax = columns.length; i < iMax; i++) {
2245       var col = columns[i];
2246       if (col.format) {
2247         fields[i] = links.TreeGrid.eval(col.format, data) || '';
2248       }
2249       else {
2250         fields[i] = (data[col.name] || '');
2251       }
2252     }
2253     this.fields = fields;
2254     this.columns = columns;
2255 
2256     // link to the icons
2257     this.icons = data._icons; 
2258 
2259     // link to the actions
2260     this.actions = data._actions;
2261     
2262     // find dataconnectors
2263     var dataconnectors = [];
2264     for (var name in data) {
2265       if (data.hasOwnProperty(name) && name.charAt(0) != '_') {
2266         var value = data[name];
2267         if (links.TreeGrid.isArray(value)) {
2268           dataconnectors.push({
2269             'name': name,
2270             'data': new links.DataTable(value)
2271           });
2272         }
2273         else if (value instanceof links.DataConnector) {
2274           dataconnectors.push({
2275             'name': name,
2276             'data': value
2277           });
2278         }
2279       }
2280       
2281       // TODO: remove warning in the future
2282       if (name == '_childs') {
2283         try {
2284           console.log('WARNING: special field _childs encountered. ' +
2285             'This field is no longer in use for subgrids, and is now a regular hidden field. ' + 
2286             'Use a fieldname without underscore instead for subgrids.');
2287         }
2288         catch (err) {}          
2289       }
2290     }
2291 
2292     // create dataconnector
2293     var dataconnector = undefined;
2294     if (dataconnectors.length == 1) {
2295       // a single dataconnector
2296       dataconnector = dataconnectors[0].data;
2297     }
2298     else if (dataconnectors.length > 1) {
2299       // create a new dataconnector containing multipe dataconnectors
2300       var options = {'showHeader': false};
2301       dataconnector = new links.DataTable(dataconnectors, options);
2302     }
2303     
2304     if (dataconnector) {
2305       // TODO: is it needed to store childs as a dataConnector here in Item?
2306       this.dataConnector = dataconnector;
2307       if (this.grid) {
2308         this.grid.setData(this.dataConnector);
2309         this.grid.update();
2310       }
2311     }
2312     else {
2313       // no data connector
2314       if (this.dataConnector) {
2315         delete this.dataConnector;
2316       }
2317       if (this.grid) {
2318         this.grid.hide();
2319         this.gridHeight = 0; // TODO: not so nice to set the height and expanded to zero like this
2320         delete this.grid;
2321       }
2322       if (this.expanded) {
2323         this.expanded = false;
2324         this.parent.unregisterExpandedItem(this);
2325       }
2326     }
2327   }
2328 };

2362  * This will not cause any repaints, but just updates the height of this node.
2363  * updateHeight() is called via an onUpdateHeight() from a child node.

2366  */ 
2367 links.TreeGrid.Item.prototype.updateHeight = function (child, diffHeight) {
2368   if (child == this.grid) {
2369     this.gridHeight += diffHeight;

2374 /**
2375  * trigger an event
2376  * @param {String} event  Event name. For example 'expand' or 'collapse'
2377  */ 
2378 links.TreeGrid.Item.prototype.onEvent = function (event) {
2379   var params = {
2380     //'index': this.index, // TODO: dangerous, invalid when items are deleted/inserted...
2381     'items': [this.data]
2382   };
2383 
2384   // send the event to the treegrid
2385   links.events.trigger(this.getTreeGrid(), event, params);
2386   
2387   // send the event to the dataconnector
2388   var dataConnector = this.parent.dataConnector; // TODO: not so nice accessing dataconnector like this
2389   if (dataConnector) {
2390     dataConnector._onEvent(event, params);
2391   }
2392 }

2394 /**
2395  * Expand or collapse the item
2396  */ 
2397 links.TreeGrid.Item.prototype.onExpand = function () {
2398   if (this.expanded) {
2399     // collapse the item
2400     this.dom.buttonExpand.className = 'treegrid-fold';
2401     this.expanded = false;
2402     this.parent.unregisterExpandedItem(this);
2403    
2404     if (this.grid) {
2405       this.grid.setVisible(false);
2406       
2407       this.gridHeight -= (this.grid.getHeight() + this.options.padding);
2408     }
2409 
2410     this.onEvent('collapse');
2411   }
2412   else {
2413     // expand the item
2414     this.dom.buttonExpand.className = 'treegrid-unfold';
2415     this.expanded = true;
2416     this.parent.registerExpandedItem(this);
2417     
2418     if (this.dataConnector) {
2419       if (!this.grid) {
2420         // create a grid for the child data
2421         this.grid = new links.TreeGrid.Grid(this.dataConnector, this.options);
2422         this.grid.setParent(this);
2423         this.grid.setLeft(this.left + this.options.indentationWidth);
2424         this.grid.setTop(this.height);
2425       }
2426 
2427       // if grid was already loaded before, make it visible
2428       this.grid.setVisible(true);
2429 
2430       this.gridHeight += (this.grid.getHeight() + this.options.padding);
2431     }
2432 
2433     this.onEvent('expand');
2434   }
2435 
2436   this.onResize();
2437 };
2438 
2439 /**
2440  * Event handler for drag start event
2441  */ 
2442 links.TreeGrid.Item.prototype.onDragOver = function(event) {
2443   if (this.dataTransfer.dragging) {
2444     return; // we cannot drop the item onto itself
2445   }
2446 
2447   // we need to repaint on every dragover event.
2448   // because the item consists of various elements, the dragenter and dragleave
2449   // events are fired every time we enter/leave one of the elements.
2450   // this causes a dragleave executed last wrongly 
2451   var threshold = this.fieldsHeight / 2;
2452   var dragbefore = (((event.offsetY || event.layerY) < threshold) || !this.dataConnector);
2453   dragbefore = false; // TODO: cleanup the dragbefore thing, and create a separate drop area for dropping inbetween
2454   this.dataTransfer.dragover   = !dragbefore;
2455   this.dataTransfer.dragbefore = dragbefore;
2456   // TODO: get the correct vertical offset, independent of the child
2457 
2458   this.repaint();
2459 
2460   links.TreeGrid.preventDefault(event);
2461   return false;
2462 }
2463

2465 /**
2466  * Event handler for drag enter event
2467  * this will highlight the current item
2468  */ 
2469 links.TreeGrid.Item.prototype.onDragEnter = function(event) {
2470   if (this.dataTransfer.dragging) {
2471     return; // we cannot drop the item onto itself
2472   }
2473   
2474   /* TODO
2475   event.dataTransfer.allowedEffect = this.dataConnector ? 'move' : 'none';
2476   event.dataTransfer.dropEffect = this.dataConnector ? 'move' : 'none';
2477   */
2478   
2479   //console.log('onDragEnter', this.dragcount, event.target);
2480   //this.dataTransfer.dragover = true;
2481   //this.repaint();
2482 
2483   return false;
2484 }
2485 
2486 /**
2487  * Event handler for drag leave event
2488  */ 
2489 links.TreeGrid.Item.prototype.onDragLeave = function(event) {
2490   if (this.dataTransfer.dragging) {
2491     return; // we cannot drop the item onto itself
2492   }
2493 
2494   //console.log('onDragLeave', this.dragcount, event.target);
2495 
2496   this.dataTransfer.dragover = false;
2497   this.dataTransfer.dragbefore = false;
2498   this.repaint();
2499   
2500   return false;
2501 }
2502 
2503 /**
2504  * Event handler for drop event
2505  */ 
2506 links.TreeGrid.Item.prototype.onDrop = function(event) {
2507   var items = event.dataTransfer.getData('items');
2508   this.dataTransfer.dragover = false;
2509   this.dataTransfer.dragbefore = false;
2510   this.repaint();
2511   
2512   //console.log('onDrop', data, event.dataTransfer.dropEffect);
2513   
2514   // TODO: trigger event
2515   
2516   if (this.dataConnector) {
2517     var me = this;
2518     var callback = function () {
2519       //* TODO
2520       if (me.expanded) {      
2521         me.onResize();
2522       }
2523       else {
2524         me.onExpand();
2525       }
2526       //*/
2527     }
2528     var errback = callback;
2529     
2530     // console.log('drop', items);
2531     
2532     // prevent a circular loop, when an item is dropped on one of its own
2533     // childs. So, remove items from which this item is a child
2534     var i = 0;
2535     while (i < items.length) {
2536       var checkItem = this;
2537       while (checkItem && checkItem != items[i]) {
2538         checkItem = checkItem.parent;
2539       }
2540       if (checkItem == items[i]) {
2541         items.splice(i, 1);
2542       }            
2543       else {
2544         i++;
2545       }
2546     }
2547     
2548     var itemsData = [];
2549     for (var i = 0; i < items.length; i++) {
2550       itemsData.push(items[i].data);
2551     }
2552     this.dataConnector.appendItems(itemsData, callback, errback);
2553   }
2554   else {
2555     console.log('dropped but do nothing', event.dataTransfer.dropEffect); // TODO
2556   }
2557   
2558   links.TreeGrid.preventDefault(event);
2559 }

2567   this._repaintLoading();
2568   this._repaintFields();
2569   this._repaintGrid();
