2582 /**
2583  * Recalculate the size of the DOM elements of the header
2584  * @return {Boolean} resized
2585  */  
2586 links.TreeGrid.Item.prototype.reflow = function () {
2587   var resized = false;
2588   
2589   // update and reflow the grid
2590   if (this.grid && this.expanded) {
2591     var gridResized = this.grid.reflow();
2592     resized = resized || gridResized;
2593   }
2594   
2595   /* TODO: needed for auto width
2596   // calculate the width of the item
2597   var width = 0;
2598   var lastColumn = this.columns ? this.columns[this.columns.length - 1] : undefined;
2599   if (lastColumn) {
2600     width = lastColumn.left + lastColumn.width;
2601   }
2602   resized = resized || (this.width != width);
2603   this.width = width;
2604   */
2605   this.width = this.getVisibleWindow().width - this.getAbsLeft(); 
2606 
2607   if (this.isVisible()) {
2608     var fieldsHeight = this.options.items.minHeight,
2609       fields = this.dom.fields,
2610       actions = this.dom.actions,
2611       icons = this.dom.icons,
2612       expandButton = this.dom.expandButton,
2613       fieldCount = fields ? fields.length : 0;
2614     
2615     // calculate width of the icons
2616     if (icons) {
2617       var iconsWidth = icons.clientWidth;
2618       if (iconsWidth != this.iconsWidth) {
2619         resized = true;
2620       }
2621       this.iconsWidth = iconsWidth;
2622     }
2623     else {
2624       // leave iconsWidth as it is
2625     }
2626     
2627     // calculate maximum height of the fields
2628     if (fields || actions || icons || expandButton || actions) {
2629       for (var i = 0; i < fieldCount; i++) {
2630         if (fields[i]) {
2631           fieldsHeight = Math.max(fieldsHeight, fields[i].clientHeight);
2632         }
2633       }
2634       if (actions) {
2635         fieldsHeight = Math.max(fieldsHeight, actions.clientHeight);
2636       }
2637       if (icons) {
2638         fieldsHeight = Math.max(fieldsHeight, icons.clientHeight);
2639       }
2640       if (expandButton) {
2641         fieldsHeight = Math.max(fieldsHeight, expandButton.clientHeight);
2642       }
2643       this.fieldsHeight = fieldsHeight;
2644     }
2645     else {
2646       // leave the fieldsheight as it is
2647     }
2648   }
2649   else {
2650     // leave the fieldsHeight as it is
2651   }
2652   
2653   // update the height of loading message
2654   if (this.loading) {
2655     if (this.dom.loading) {
2656       this.loadingHeight = this.dom.loading.clientHeight;
2657     }
2658     else {
2659       // leave the height as it is
2660     }
2661   }
2662   else {
2663     this.loadingHeight = 0;
2664   }
2665 
2666   // update the height of error message
2667   if (this.error) {
2668     if (this.dom.error) {
2669       this.errorHeight = this.dom.error.clientHeight;
2670     }
2671     else {
2672       // leave the height as it is
2673     }
2674   }
2675   else {
2676     this.errorHeight = 0;
2677   }
2678   
2679   // update the height of the fields empty, error, and loading
2680   var height = 0;
2681   height += this.fieldsHeight;
2682   height += this.loadingHeight;
2683   height += this.errorHeight;
2684   height += this.gridHeight;
2685   if (height == 0) {
2686     height = this.options.items.defaultHeight;
2687   }
2688   
2689   var diffHeight = (height - this.height);
2690   if (diffHeight) {
2691     resized = true;
2692     this.height = height;
2693     this.onUpdateHeight(diffHeight);
2694   }
2695   
2696   return resized;
2697 }
2698

2700 /**
2701  * Get the visible range from the given window
2702  * @param {Object} window       An object with parameters top, left, width,
2703  *                              height.
2704  * @param {Object} currentRange optional, current range. makes getting the range 
2705  *                              faster. Object containing a parameter offset and
2706  *                              limit
2707  * @return {Object} range       An object with parameters offset and limit
2708  */ 
2709 links.TreeGrid.Grid.prototype._getRangeFromWindow = function(window, currentRange) {
2710   // use the current range as start
2711   var defaultHeight = this.options.items.defaultHeight,
2712     itemCount = (this.itemCount != undefined) ? this.itemCount : Math.ceil(window.height / defaultHeight),
2713     windowTop = -this.getAbsTop() + this.header.getHeight(), // normalize the top
2714     windowBottom = windowTop + window.height - this.header.getHeight(),
2715     newOffset = currentRange ? currentRange.offset : 0,
2716     newLimit = 0;
2717 
2718   var item, top, height, bottom;
2719 
2720   //console.log('_getRangeFromWindow', window.top, window.top + window.height, this.top, this.top + this.height)
2721 
2722   // find the first visible item
2723   item = this.items[newOffset];
2724   top = item ? item.top : this._calculateItemTop(newOffset);
2725   height = item ? item.getHeight() : defaultHeight;
2726   bottom = top + height;
2727   while ((newOffset < itemCount - 1) && (bottom < windowTop)) {
2728     newOffset++;
2729     item = this.items[newOffset];
2730     top = bottom + this.dropAreaHeight;
2731     height = item ? item.getHeight() : defaultHeight;
2732     bottom = top + height;
2733   }
2734   while ((newOffset > 0) && top > windowTop) {
2735     newOffset--;
2736     item = this.items[newOffset];
2737     height = item ? item.getHeight() : defaultHeight;
2738     bottom = top;
2739     top = top - height - this.dropAreaHeight;
2740   }
2741 
2742   // find the last visible item
2743   while ((newOffset + newLimit < itemCount - 1) && (top < windowBottom)) {
2744     newLimit++;
2745     item = this.items[newOffset + newLimit];
2746     top = bottom + this.dropAreaHeight;
2747     height = item ? item.getHeight() : defaultHeight;
2748     bottom = top + height;
2749     //console.log('item', newOffset + newLimit, top, height, bottom, windowBottom) // TODO: cleanup
2750   }
2751   if (top < windowBottom && bottom > windowTop && newOffset + newLimit < itemCount) {
2752     newLimit++;
2753   }
2754 
2755   // console.log('range', this.left, newOffset, newLimit, newLimit ? newOffset + newLimit-1 : undefined); // TODO: cleanup
2756 
2757   return {
2758     'offset': newOffset,
2759     'limit': newLimit
2760   };  
2761 };

2764 /**
2765  * Repaint the HTML DOM fields of this item
2766  */ 
2767 links.TreeGrid.Item.prototype._repaintFields = function() {
2768   if (this.isVisible() && this.fields ) {
2769     // check if the fields are changed
2770     var fields = this.fields;
2771     var prevFields = this.prevFields;
2772     if (fields != prevFields) {
2773       // fields are changed. remove old dom
2774       if (this.dom.frame) {
2775         this.dom.frame.parentNode.removeChild(this.dom.frame);
2776         delete this.dom.frame;
2777       }
2778       this.prevFields = fields;
2779     }
2780 
2781     var domFrame = this.dom.frame;
2782     if (!domFrame) {
2783       // create the dom frame
2784       var domFrame = document.createElement('DIV');
2785       domFrame.className = 'treegrid-item';
2786       domFrame.style.position = 'absolute'; // TODO
2787       //domFrame.style.position = 'relative';
2788       domFrame.item = this;
2789       domFrame.treeGridType = 'item';
2790       this.dom.frame = domFrame;
2791       //this.getContainer().appendChild(domFrame); // TODO
2792       
2793       // create expand button
2794       if (this.dataConnector) {
2795         var buttonExpand = document.createElement('button');
2796         buttonExpand.treeGridType = 'expand';
2797         buttonExpand.className = this.expanded ? 'treegrid-unfold' : 'treegrid-fold';
2798         buttonExpand.style.position = 'absolute';
2799         buttonExpand.grid = this; // TODO: is this used and needed?
2800         buttonExpand.node = this;
2801         buttonExpand.index = this.index; // TODO: remove this index, use the node instead
2802         
2803         domFrame.appendChild(buttonExpand);
2804         this.dom.buttonExpand = buttonExpand;    
2805       }
2806 
2807       // create icons
2808       var icons = this.icons;
2809       if (icons) {
2810         var domIcons = document.createElement('DIV');
2811         domIcons.className = 'treegrid-icons';
2812         domIcons.style.position = 'absolute';
2813         domIcons.style.top = '0px';
2814         for (var i = 0, iMax = icons.length; i < iMax; i++) {
2815           var icon = icons[i];
2816           if (icon  && icon.image) {
2817             var domIcon = document.createElement('img');
2818             domIcon.className = 'treegrid-icon';
2819             domIcon.src = icon.image;
2820             domIcon.title = icon.title ? icon.title : '';
2821             domIcon.style.width = icon.width ? icon.width : '';
2822             domIcon.style.height = icon.height ? icon.height : '';
2823             domIcons.appendChild(domIcon);
2824           }
2825         }
2826         domFrame.appendChild(domIcons);
2827         this.dom.icons = domIcons;
2828       }
2829 
2830       // create the fields
2831       var domFields = [];
2832       this.dom.fields = domFields;
2833       var padding = this.options.padding;
2834       var fields = this.fields;
2835       var height = this.height;
2836       for (var i = 0, iMax = fields.length; i < iMax; i++) {
2837         field = fields[i];
2838 
2839         var domField = document.createElement('DIV');
2840         domField.className = 'treegrid-item-field';
2841         domField.style.position = 'absolute';
2842         //domField.style.position = 'relative';
2843         domField.style.top = '0px';
2844 
2845         var col = this.columns[i];
2846         if (col.fixedWidth) {
2847           domField.style.width = col.width + 'px';
2848         }
2849 
2850         domField.innerHTML = field;
2851         domFrame.appendChild(domField);
2852         domFields.push(domField);
2853       }
2854       
2855       // create the actions
2856       if (this.actions) {
2857         var actions = this.actions;
2858         var domActions = document.createElement('DIV');
2859         this.dom.actions = domActions;
2860         domActions.style.position = 'absolute';
2861         domActions.className = 'treegrid-actions';
2862         domActions.style.top = 0 + 'px';
2863         domActions.style.right = 24 + 'px';  // reckon with width of the scrollbar      
2864         for (var i = 0, iMax = actions.length; i < iMax; i++) {
2865           var action = actions[i];
2866           if (action.event) {
2867             if (action.image) {
2868               // create an image button
2869               var domAction = document.createElement('INPUT');
2870               domAction.treeGridType = 'action';
2871               domAction.type = 'image';
2872               domAction.className = 'treegrid-action-image';
2873               domAction.title = action.title || '';
2874               domAction.src = action.image;
2875               domAction.event = action.event;
2876               domAction.item = this;
2877               domActions.appendChild(domAction);
2878             }
2879             else {
2880               // create a text link
2881               var domAction = document.createElement('A');
2882               domAction.treeGridType = 'action';
2883               domAction.className = 'treegrid-action-link';
2884               domAction.href = '#';
2885               domAction.title = action.title || '';
2886               domAction.innerHTML = action.text ? action.text : action.event;
2887               domAction.event = action.event;
2888               domAction.item = this;
2889               domActions.appendChild(domAction);
2890             }
2891           }
2892           else {
2893             // TODO: throw warning?
2894           }
2895         }
2896         
2897         domFrame.appendChild(domActions);
2898       }
2899 
2900       // create event handlers for drag and drop
2901       var item = this;
2902       // TODO: not so nice accessing the parent grid like this
2903       
2904       var dataTransfer = this.dataConnector ? this.dataConnector.getOptions().dataTransfer : undefined;
2905       if (dataTransfer) {
2906         if (dataTransfer.dropEffect != undefined && dataTransfer.dropEffect != 'none') {
2907           this.dataTransfer.dropEffect = dataTransfer.dropEffect;
2908 
2909           links.dnd.makeDroppable(domFrame, {
2910             'dropEffect': dataTransfer.dropEffect,
2911             'drop': function (event) {item.onDrop(event);},
2912             'dragEnter': function (event) {item.onDragEnter(event);},
2913             'dragOver': function (event) {item.onDragOver(event);},
2914             'dragLeave': function (event) {item.onDragLeave(event);}
2915           });
2916         }
2917       }
2918     }
2919     
2920     if (!domFrame.parentNode) {
2921       this.getContainer().appendChild(domFrame);
2922     }
2923 
2924     // position the frame
2925     domFrame.style.top = this.getAbsTop() + 'px';
2926     domFrame.style.left = this.getAbsLeft() + 'px';
2927     // TODO
2928     //domFrame.style.top = 0 + 'px';
2929     //domFrame.style.left = 0 + 'px';
2930     domFrame.style.height = this.fieldsHeight + 'px';
2931     domFrame.style.width = this.width-2 + 'px';
2932     
2933     // position the icons
2934     var domIcons = this.dom.icons;
2935     if (domIcons) {
2936       domIcons.style.left = this.options.indentationWidth + 'px';
2937     }
2938     
2939     // position the fields
2940     var domFields = this.dom.fields;
2941     if (domFields) {
2942       for (var i = 0, iMax = this.columns.length; i < iMax; i++) {
2943         var col = this.columns[i];
2944         var domField = domFields[i];
2945         if (domField) {
2946           domField.style.left = col.left + 'px';
2947         }
2948       }
2949     }
2950     
2951     // show/hide the expand button (hide in case of error, to make place for an error icon)
2952     if (this.dom.buttonExpand) {
2953       this.dom.buttonExpand.style.visibility = (this.error == undefined) ? 'visible' : 'hidden';
2954     }
2955 
2956     // check the class name depending on the status
2957     var className = 'treegrid-item';
2958     if (this.selected || this.dataTransfer.dragging) {
2959       className += ' treegrid-item-selected';
2960     }
2961     else if (this.dataTransfer.dragover) {
2962       className += ' treegrid-item-dragover';
2963     }
2964     else if (this.dataTransfer.dragbefore) {
2965       className += ' treegrid-item-dragbefore';
2966     }
2967     if (this.dirty) {
2968       className += ' treegrid-item-dirty';
2969     }
2970     domFrame.className = className;
2971   }
2972   else {
2973     links.dnd.removeDraggable(this.dom.frame);
2974     links.dnd.removeDroppable(this.dom.frame);
2975     
2976     if (this.dom.frame && this.dom.frame.parentNode) {
2977       this.dom.frame.parentNode.removeChild(this.dom.frame);
2978     }
2979     if (this.dom.frame) {
2980       this.dom = {}; 
2981     }
2982   }
2983 };

3140  */ 
3141 links.TreeGrid.DropArea.prototype.reflow = function () {

3145 /**
3146  * repaint the droparea
3147  */
3148 links.TreeGrid.DropArea.prototype.repaint = function () {
3149   if (this.isVisible()) {
3150     var dropArea = this.dom.dropArea;
3151     
3152     // create the droparea
3153     if (!dropArea) {
3154       var container = this.getContainer();
3155       var dropArea = document.createElement('DIV');
3156       dropArea.style.position = 'absolute';
3157       dropArea.style.left = '0px';
3158       dropArea.style.top = '0px';
3159       dropArea.style.height = this.height + 'px';
3160       container.appendChild(dropArea);
3161       this.dom.dropArea = dropArea;
3162 
3163       // drop events
3164       var dataTransfer = this.dataConnector ? this.dataConnector.getOptions().dataTransfer : undefined;
3165       if (dataTransfer) {
3166         var me = this;
3167         this.dropEffect = dataTransfer.dropEffect;
3168         links.TreeGrid.addEventListener(dropArea, 'dragover', 
3169           function (event) {
3170             return me.onDragOver(event); 
3171         });
3172         links.TreeGrid.addEventListener(dropArea, 'dragenter', 
3173           function (event) {
3174             return me.onDragEnter(event);
3175         });
3176         links.TreeGrid.addEventListener(dropArea, 'dragleave', 
3177           function (event) {
3178             return me.onDragLeave(event);
3179         });
3180         links.TreeGrid.addEventListener(dropArea, 'drop', 
3181           function (event) {
3182             return me.onDrop(event);
3183         });
3184       }      
3185     }
3186     
3187     // position the droparea
3188     dropArea.className = this.dragover ? 'treegrid-droparea' : '';
3189     dropArea.style.top = this.getAbsTop() + 'px';
3190     dropArea.style.left = this.getAbsLeft() + 'px';
3191     dropArea.style.width = (this.width - 2) + 'px';
3192   }
3193   else {
3194     if (this.dom.dropArea) {
3195       this.dom.dropArea.parentNode.removeChild(this.dom.dropArea);
3196       delete this.dom.dropArea;
3197     }
3198   }
3199 }

3283 /**
3284  * Convert an error to string
3285  * @param {any type} err
3286  * @return {String} err
3287  */ 
3288 links.TreeGrid.Grid._errorToString = function(err) {
3289   if (typeof(err) == 'string') {
3290     return err;
3291   }
3292   else if (err instanceof Object) {
3293     if (err.message && typeof(err.message) == 'string') {
3294       return err.message;
3295     }
3296     if (err.error && typeof(err.error) == 'string') {
3297       return err.error;
3298     }
3299     if (JSON) {
3300       return JSON.stringify(err);
3301     }
3302   }
3303   
3304   return String(err);
3305 };

3308 /**
3309  * @prototype VerticalScroll
3310  * creates a vertical scrollbar in given HTML DOM element
3311  * @param {HTML DOM} container   Scroll bar will be created inside this
3312  *                               container
3313  * @param {Number} min           Minimum value for the scrollbar
3314  * @param {Number} max           Maximum value for the scrollbar
3315  * @param {Number} value         Current value of the scrollbar
3316  */
3317 links.TreeGrid.VerticalScroll = function (container, min, max, value) {
3318   this.container = container;
3319   this.dom = {};
3320   this.height = 0;
3321   
3322   this.min = 0;
3323   this.max = 0;
3324   this.value = 0;
3325 
3326   // eventParams can contain event data for example on mouse down.
3327   this.eventParams = {};
3328   this.onChangeHandlers = [];
3329 
3330   this.setInterval(min, max);
3331   this.set(value);
3332 };
3333 
3334 /**
3335  * Redraw the scrollbar
3336  */ 
3337 links.TreeGrid.VerticalScroll.prototype.redraw = function () {
3338   var background = this.dom.background;
3339   if (!background) {
3340     background = document.createElement('div');
3341     background.className = 'treegrid-verticalscroll-background';
3342     background.style.width = '100%';
3343     background.style.height = '100%';
3344     this.container.appendChild(background);
3345 
3346     this.dom.background = background;
3347   }
3348 
3349   var bar = this.dom.bar;
3350   if (!bar) {
3351     bar = document.createElement('div');
3352     bar.className = 'treegrid-verticalscroll-bar';
3353     bar.style.position = 'absolute';
3354     bar.style.left = '20%';
3355     bar.style.width = '60%';
3356     bar.style.right = '20%';
3357     bar.style.top = '0px';
3358     bar.style.height = '0px';
3359     this.container.appendChild(bar);
3360     
3361     var me = this;
3362     var params = this.eventParams;
3363     params._onMouseDown = function (event) {
3364       me._onMouseDown(event);
3365     }
3366     links.TreeGrid.addEventListener(bar, 'mousedown', params._onMouseDown);
3367     
3368     this.dom.bar = bar;
3369   }
3370 
3371   // position the bar
3372   var interval = (this.max - this.min);
3373   if (interval > 0) {
3374     var height = this.height;
3375     var borderWidth = 2; // TODO: retrieve borderWidth from css?
3376     var barHeight = Math.max(height * height / (interval + height), 20);
3377     var barTop = this.value * (height - barHeight - 2 * borderWidth) / interval;
3378     bar.style.height = barHeight + 'px';
3379     bar.style.top = barTop + 'px';
3380     bar.style.display = '';
3381   }
3382   else {
3383     bar.style.display = 'none';
3384   }
3385 };

3388 /**
3389  * Check if the scrollbar is resized and if so, redraw the scrollbar
3390  * @return {Boolean} resized
3391  */ 
3392 links.TreeGrid.VerticalScroll.prototype.checkResize = function () {
3393   var resized = this.reflow();
3394   if (resized) {
3395     this.redraw();
3396   }
3397   return resized;
3398 };

3400 /**
3401  * Recalculate the size of the elements of the scrollbar
3402  */ 
3403 links.TreeGrid.VerticalScroll.prototype.reflow = function () {
3404   var resized = false;
3405   
3406   this.height = this.dom.background.clientHeight;
3407   
3408   return resized;
3409 };

3411 /**
3412  * Set the interval for the vertical scroll bar
3413  * @param {Number} min    Minimum value, start of the interval
3414  * @param {Number} max    Maximum value, end of the interval
3415  */ 
3416 links.TreeGrid.VerticalScroll.prototype.setInterval = function (min, max) {
3417   this.min = min || 0;
3418   this.max = max || 0;
3419   if (this.max < this.min) {
3420     this.max = this.min;
3421   }
3422   
3423   // value may be out of range now, so set it again
3424   this.set(this.value);
3425 };
3426 
3427 
3428 /**
3429  * Set the current value of the scrollbar
3430  * The value must be within the range of the scrollbar 
3431  * @param {Number} value
3432  */ 
3433 links.TreeGrid.VerticalScroll.prototype.set = function (value) {
3434   this.value = value || this.min;
3435   if (this.value < this.min) {
3436     this.value = this.min;
3437   }
3438   if (this.value > this.max) {
3439     this.value = this.max;
3440   }
3441 
3442   this.redraw();
3443 };
3444 
3445 /**
3446  * Increase or decrease the value of the scrollbar by a delta
3447  * @param {Number} delta   A positive or negative value
3448  */ 
3449 links.TreeGrid.VerticalScroll.prototype.increase = function (delta) {
3450   var value = this.get();
3451   value += delta;
3452   this.set(value);
3453 };

3464 /**
3465  * Handler for mouse down event for scrollbar
3466  * @param {Event} event
3467  */ 
3468 links.TreeGrid.VerticalScroll.prototype._onMouseDown = function(event) {
3469   var params = this.eventParams
3470 
3471   event = event || window.event;
3472   params.startMouseX = event.clientX;
3473   params.startMouseY = event.clientY;
3474   params.startValue = this.value;
3475 
3476   var me = this;
3477   if (!params._onMouseMove) {
3478     params._onMouseMove = function (event) {me._onMouseMove(event);};
3479     links.TreeGrid.addEventListener(document, "mousemove", params._onMouseMove);
3480   }
3481   if (!params._onMouseUp) {
3482     params._onMouseUp = function (event) {me._onMouseUp(event);};
3483     links.TreeGrid.addEventListener(document, "mouseup", params._onMouseUp);
3484   }
3485   
3486   links.TreeGrid.preventDefault(event);
3487   links.TreeGrid.stopPropagation(event);
3488 };
3489 
3490 /**
3491  * Handler for mouse move event for scrollbar
3492  * @param {Event} event
3493  */ 
3494 links.TreeGrid.VerticalScroll.prototype._onMouseMove = function(event) {
3495   var params = this.eventParams
3496 
3497   event = event || window.event;
3498   var mouseX = event.clientX;
3499   var mouseY = event.clientY;
3500   var diffX = mouseX - params.startMouseX;
3501   var diffY = mouseY - params.startMouseY;
3502 
3503   var interval = (this.max - this.min);
3504   var diff = (diffY / this.height) * (interval + this.height);
3505     
3506   this.set(params.startValue + diff);
3507 
3508   this._callbackOnChangeHandlers();
3509   
3510   links.TreeGrid.preventDefault(event);
3511   links.TreeGrid.stopPropagation(event);
3512 };
3513 
3514 
3515 /**
3516  * Handler for mouse up event for scrollbar
3517  * @param {Event} event
3518  */ 
3519 links.TreeGrid.VerticalScroll.prototype._onMouseUp = function(event) {
3520   var params = this.eventParams;
3521   var me = this;
3522   
3523   // remove event listeners
3524   if (params._onMouseMove) {
3525     links.TreeGrid.removeEventListener(document, "mousemove", params._onMouseMove);
3526     params._onMouseMove = undefined;
3527   }
3528   if (!params.onMouseUp) {
3529     links.TreeGrid.removeEventListener(document, "mouseup", params._onMouseUp);
3530     params._onMouseUp = undefined;
3531   }
3532   
3533   links.TreeGrid.preventDefault(event);
3534   links.TreeGrid.stopPropagation(event);
3535 };
3536 
3537 /**
3538  * Add a callback hander which is executed when the value of the scroll
3539  * bar is changed by the user (not after the method set() is executed)
3540  * The callback is executed with the new value as parameter
3541  * @param {Function} callback
3542  */ 
3543 links.TreeGrid.VerticalScroll.prototype.addOnChangeHandler = function(callback) {
3544   this.removeOnChangeHandler(callback);
3545   this.onChangeHandlers.push(callback);
3546 };
3547 
3548 /**
3549  * Remove an onchange callback hander
3550  * @param {Function} callback   Handler to be removed
3551  */ 
3552 links.TreeGrid.VerticalScroll.prototype.removeOnChangeHandler = function(callback) {
3553   var index = this.onChangeHandlers.indexOf(callback);
3554   this.onChangeHandlers.splice(index, 1);
3555 };
3556 
3557 
3558 /**
3559  * Call all onchange callback handlers
3560  */ 
3561 links.TreeGrid.VerticalScroll.prototype._callbackOnChangeHandlers = function() {
3562   var handlers = this.onChangeHandlers;
3563   var value = this.value;
3564   for (var i = 0, iMax = handlers.length; i < iMax; i++) {
3565     handlers[i](value);
3566   }
3567 };

3574  */ 
3575 links.DataConnector = function (options) {
3576   this.options = options || {};
3577   this.eventListeners = []; // registered event handlers

3580 /**
3581  * Trigger an event
3582  * @param {String} event
3583  * @param {Object} params
3584  */ 
3585 links.DataConnector.prototype.trigger = function (event, params) {
3586   // send the event to the treegrid
3587   links.events.trigger(this, event, params);  
3588 
3589   // trigger the google event bus
3590   if (google && google.visualization && google.visualization.events) {
3591     google.visualization.events.trigger(this, event, params);    
3592   }
3593 
3594   // TODO: remove this code?
3595   // send the event to all event listeners
3596   var eventListeners = this.eventListeners;
3597   for (var i = 0, iMax = eventListeners.length; i < iMax; i++) {
3598     var callback = eventListeners[i];
3599     callback (event, params);
3600   }
3601 }

3835  *                            object as parameter, containing fields:
3836  *                              {Number} totalItems
3837  *                              {Array with Objects} items
3838  * @param {function} errback  Callback method called on failure. Called with
3839  *                            an error message as parameter.

3841 links.DataTable.prototype.getItems = function (index, num, callback, errback) {
3842   var items = [],
3843     filteredData = this.filteredData,
3844     count = filteredData.length;
3845   for (var i = index, iMax = Math.min(index + num, count) ; i < iMax; i++) {
3846     items.push(filteredData[i]);
3847   }
3848   callback({
3849     'totalItems': filteredData.length,
3850     'items':      items
3851   });

3856  * Asynchronously update a number of items. 
3857  * The callback returns the updated items, which may be newly instantiated objects .
3858  * @param {Array with Objects} items      
3859  *                            A list with items to be updated
3860  * @param {function} callback Callback method called on success. Called with one 
3861  *                            object as parameter, containing fields:
3862  *                              {Number} totalItems
3863  *                              {Array with Objects} items    The updated items
3864  * @param {function} errback  Callback method called on failure. Called with
3865  *                            an error message as parameter.
3866  */
3867 links.DataTable.prototype.updateItems = function (items, callback, errback) {
3868   var num = items.length;
3869   var data = this.data;
3870   for (var i = 0; i < num; i++) {
3871     var item = items[i];
3872     var index = data.indexOf(item);
3873     if (index != -1) {
3874       data[index] = item;
3875     }
3876     else {
3877       errback("Cannot find item"); // TODO: better error
3878       return;
3879     }
3880   }
3881 
3882   // perform filtering and sorting again if there is a filter set
3883   this.updateFilters();
3884   
3885   callback({
3886     'totalItems': this.filteredData.length,
3887     'items': items
3888   });
3889   
3890   this.trigger('change', undefined);
3891 };

3935 links.DataTable.prototype.insertItemsBefore = function (items, beforeItem, callback, errback) {
3936   // find the item before which the new items will be inserted
3937   var data = this.data;
3938   var beforeIndex = data.indexOf(beforeItem);
3939   if (beforeIndex == -1) {
3940     errback("Cannot find item"); // TODO: better error
3941     return;
3942   }
3943   
3944   // insert the new data
3945   var num = items.length;
3946   for (var i = 0; i < num; i++) {
3947     data.splice(beforeIndex + i, 0, items[i]);
3948   }      
3949   
3950   // perform filtering and sorting again if there is a filter set
3951   this.updateFilters();
3952 
3953   callback({
3954     'totalItems': this.filteredData.length,
3955     'items': items
3956   });

3965  * @param {Array with Objects} items      
3966  *                            A list with items to be moved
3967  * @param {Object} beforeItem The items will be inserted before this item.
3968  *                            When beforeItem is undefined, the items will be
3969  *                            moved to the end of the data.
3970  * @param {function} callback Callback method called on success. Called with one 
3971  *                            object as parameter, containing fields:
3972  *                              {Number} totalItems
3973  *                              {Array with Objects} items    The moved items
3974  * @param {function} errback  Callback method called on failure. Called with
3975  *                            an error message as parameter.
3976  */
3977 links.DataTable.prototype.moveItems = function (items, beforeItem, callback, errback) {
3978   // find the index of the before item
3979   var beforeIndex = this.data.indexOf(beforeItems);
3980   if (beforeIndex == -1) {
3981     errback("Cannot find item"); // TODO: better error
3982     return;
3983   }
3984 
3985   // find the indexes of all items
3986   var num = items.length;
3987   var indexes = [];
3988   for (var i = 0; i < num; i++) {
3989     var index = this.data.indexOf(items[i]);
3990     if (index != -1) {
3991       indexes[i] = index;
3992     }
3993     else {
3994       errback("Cannot find item"); // TODO: better error
3995       return;
3996     }
3997   }
3998 
3999   // if all items are found, move them
4000   for (var i = 0; i < num; i++) {
4001     this.data.splice(indexes[i], 1);
4002     this.data.splice(beforeIndex, 0, items[i]);
4003   }  
4004   
4005   // perform filtering and sorting again if there is a filter set
4006   this.updateFilters();
4007   
4008   callback({
4009     'totalItems': this.filteredData.length,
4010     'items': items
4011   });
4012 
4013   this.trigger('change', undefined);  
4014 };

4062  *                            object as parameter, containing fields:
4063  *                              {Number} totalItems
4064  *                              {Array with Objects} items    The changed items

4068 links.DataTable.prototype.getChanges = function (index, num, items, callback, errback) {
4069   var changedItems = [],
4070     filteredData = this.filteredData,
4071     count = filteredData.length;
4072

4074     var item = items[i];
4075     if (item != filteredData[index + i]) {
4076       changedItems.push(item);
4077     }
4078   }
4079   
4080   callback({
4081     'totalItems': this.filteredData.length,
4082     'items': changedItems
4083   });

4104 /**
4105  * Update the filters (if any).
4106  * This method is executed after the data has been changed.
4107  */ 
4108 links.DataTable.prototype.updateFilters = function () {
4109   if (this.filters) {
4110     this.setFilters(this.filters);
4111   }
4112   else {
4113     this.filteredData = this.data;
4114   }
4115 }

4117 /**
4118  * Set a filter for this DataTable
4119  * @param {Array with Objects} filters An array containing filter objects.
4120  *                                     a filter object contains parameters 
4121  *                                     field, value, startValue, endValue, 
4122  *                                     values, order
4123  */ 
4124 // TODO: comment
4125 links.DataTable.prototype.setFilters = function (filters) {
4126   var data = this.data;
4127   var filteredData = [];
4128   this.filteredData = filteredData;
4129   this.filters = filters;
4130   
4131   // filter the data
4132   for (var i = 0, iMax = data.length; i < iMax; i++) {
4133     var item = data[i];
4134     var emit = true;
4135     for (var f = 0, fMax = filters.length; f < fMax; f++) {
4136       var filter = filters[f];
4137       if (filter.field) {
4138         var value = item[filter.field];
4139         if (filter.value && (value != filter.value)) {
4140           emit = false;
4141         }
4142         if (filter.startValue && value < filter.startValue) {
4143           emit = false;
4144         }
4145         if (filter.endValue && value > filter.endValue) {
4146           emit = false;
4147         }
4148         if (filter.values && (filter.values.indexOf(value) == -1)) {
4149           emit = false;
4150         }
4151       }
4152     }
4153     
4154     if (emit) {
4155       filteredData.push(item);
4156     }
4157   }
4158   
4159   // create a list with fields that need to be ordered
4160   var orders = [];
4161   for (var f = 0, fMax = filters.length; f < fMax; f++) {
4162     var filter = filters[f];
4163     if (filter.field && filter.order) {
4164       var order = filter.order.toUpperCase();
4165       if (order == 'ASC' || order == 'DESC') {
4166         orders.push({
4167           'field': filter.field,
4168           'direction': ((order == 'ASC') ? 1 : -1)
4169         });
4170       }
4171       else {
4172         throw 'Unknown order "' + order + '". ' +
4173           'Available values: "ASC", "DESC".';
4174       }
4175     }
4176   }
4177 
4178   // order the filtered data
4179   var ordersLength = orders.length;
4180   if (ordersLength) {
4181     filteredData.sort(function (a, b) {
4182       for (var i = 0; i < ordersLength; i++) {
4183         var order = orders[i],
4184           field = order.field,
4185           direction = order.direction;
4186 
4187         if (a[field] == b[field]) {
4188           if (i == ordersLength - 1) {
4189             return 0;
4190           }
4191           else {
4192             // compare with the next filter
4193           }
4194         }
4195         else {
4196           return (a[field] > b[field]) ? direction : -direction;
4197         }
4198       }
4199     });
4200   }
4201 };

4208 // TODO: update the couchconnector
4209 links.CouchConnector = function (url) {
4210   this.url = url;

4212   this.filter = undefined;
4213 
4214   this.updateSeq = undefined;
4215   this.blockSize = 16; // data will be retrieved in blocks of this blockSize
4216   // TODO: make blockSize customizable
4217 
4218   this.totalItems = this.blockSize;
4219 };

4221 links.CouchConnector.prototype = new links.DataConnector();;
4222 
4223 links.CouchConnector.prototype.getItems = function (index, num, callback, errback) {
4224   // first check if the requested data is already loaded
4225   var me = this;
4226   var data = this.data;
4227   var dataComplete = true;
4228   for (var i = index, iMax = index + num; i < iMax; i++) {
4229     if (data[i] == undefined) {
4230       dataComplete = false;
4231       break;
4232     }
4233   }
4234 
4235   // TODO: smarter retrieve only the missing parts of the data, not the whole interval again. 
4236   
4237   function getSubset (index, num) {
4238     var dataSubset = [];
4239     for (var i = index, iMax = index + num; i < iMax; i++) {
4240       var d = data[i];
4241       dataSubset.push(d ? d.value : undefined);
4242     }
4243     return dataSubset;    
4244   }
4245 
4246   if (dataComplete) {
4247     var dataChanged = false;
4248     // if all data is available, check if data has changed on the server
4249     // TODO: check change of update sequence
4250     
4251     if (dataChanged) {
4252       // clear all data
4253       this.data = [];
4254       data = this.data;
4255       dataComplete = false;
4256     }
4257   }  
4258 
4259   if (!dataComplete) {
4260     // choose skip and limit to match block size
4261     var skipRem = index % this.blockSize,
4262       skip = index - skipRem,
4263       limitRem = (num + skipRem) % this.blockSize,
4264       limit = (num + skipRem - limitRem) + (limitRem != 0 ? this.blockSize : 0);
4265 
4266     // cut off the part of items which are already loaded
4267     while (data[skip] && limit > 0) {
4268       skip++;
4269       limit--;
4270     }
4271     while (data[skip + limit - 1] && limit > 0) {
4272       limit--;
4273     }
4274 
4275     // find a startkey, to spead up the request
4276     var startkey = undefined;
4277     var startKeyIndex = skip - 1;
4278     while (startKeyIndex > 0 && data[startKeyIndex] == undefined) {
4279       startKeyIndex--;
4280     }
4281     if (data[startKeyIndex]) {
4282       startkey = data[startKeyIndex].key;
4283     }
4284     
4285     var separator = (this.url.indexOf('?') == -1) ? '?' : '&';
4286     var url;
4287     if (startkey) {
4288       url = this.url + separator + 
4289         'skip=' + (skip - startKeyIndex) + 
4290         '&limit=' + limit + 
4291         '&startkey=' + escape(JSON.stringify(startkey));
4292       
4293       // TODO: reckon with filter?
4294     }
4295     else {
4296       url = this.url + separator + 'skip=' + skip + '&limit=' + limit;
4297       
4298       if (this.filter) {
4299         if (this.filter.value != undefined) {
4300           url += '&key=' + escape(JSON.stringify(this.filter.value));
4301         }
4302         if (this.filter.startValue != undefined) {
4303           url += '&startkey=' + escape(JSON.stringify(this.filter.startValue));
4304         }
4305         if (this.filter.endValue != undefined) {
4306           url += '&endkey=' + escape(JSON.stringify(this.filter.endValue));
4307         }
4308       }      
4309     }
4310     
4311     /* TODO: descending order 
4312     if (this.filter && this.filter.order) {
4313       if (this.filter.order == 'DESC') {
4314         url += '&descending=true';
4315         // TODO: startkey and endkey must be interchanged
4316       } 
4317     }
4318     */
4319     
4320     // TODO: reckon with filter values
4321     // TODO: reckon with filter order: asc/desc
4322     
4323     // TODO: using skip for paginating results is a very bad solution, very slow
4324     //       create a smarter solution to retrieve results with an as small as
4325     //       possible skip, starting at the closest retrieved document key 
4326     
4327     //console.log('Retrieving data from server url=' + url);
4328 
4329     links.getJSONP(url, function (response) {
4330       if (response.error) {
4331         errback(response);
4332         return;
4333       }
4334 
4335       var rows = response.rows;
4336       var dataSubset = [];
4337       for (var i = 0, iMax = rows.length; i < iMax; i++) {
4338         data[i + skip] = rows[i];
4339       }
4340 
4341       // set the number of total items
4342       me.totalItems = Math.min(me.data.length + me.blockSize, response.total_rows);
4343       
4344       var dataSubset = getSubset(index, num);
4345       callback({
4346         'totalItems': me.totalItems,
4347         'items': dataSubset
4348       });
4349       return;
4350     }, errback);
4351   }
4352   else {
4353     // all data is already loaded
4354     var dataSubset = getSubset(index, num);
4355     callback({
4356       'totalItems': me.totalItems,
4357       'items': dataSubset
4358     });
4359   }
4360 };
4361 
4362 links.CouchConnector.prototype._getUpdateSeq = function (callback, errback) {
4363   var viewIndex = this.url.indexOf('_view');
4364   if (viewIndex == -1) {
4365     errback('Error: cannot get information on this view, url is no view');
4366     return;
4367   }
4368   
4369   // TODO: check _change?since=3 
4370   // http://guide.couchdb.org/draft/notifications.html
4371   
4372   var url = this.url.substring(0, viewIndex) + '_info';
4373   
4374   links.getJSONP(url, function (info) {
4375     if (data.error) {
4376       errback(data);
4377       return;
4378     }
4379     
4380     var update_seq = info.view_index.update_seq;    
4381     callback(update_seq);
4382     return;
4383   }, errback);
4384 };

4390

4392 
4393   callback({
4394     'totalItems': (this.totalItems || 10),
4395     'items': changedItems
4396   });
4397   return changedItems;
4398 }

4418 /**
4419  * Retrieve a JSON response via javascript injection.
4420  * Note1: it is not possible to know when the injection failed, but you can 
4421  * create a timeout which checks if the callback has been called succesfully 
4422  * and if not, throw an error.
4423  * Note2: jsonp must be enabled on the server side. (For example in the 
4424  * couchdb configuration the option 'allow_jsonp' must be set true)
4425  * @author Jos de Jong
4426  * @param {String} url         The url to be retrieved
4427  * @param {function} callback. On response, the callback function will be called
4428  *                             with the retrieved data as parameter (JSON object)
4429  * @param {function} errback   On error, the errback function will be called
4430  *                             without parameters
4431  */
4432 links.getJSONP = function (url, callback, errback) {
4433   //console.log('getJSONP ' + url) // TODO: cleanup
4434   
4435   // create a random function name to use as temporary callback function
4436   var callbackName = 'callback' + Math.round(Math.random() * 1e10);
4437   
4438   // create a script to be injected in the document
4439   var script = document.createElement('script');
4440   var separator = (url.indexOf('?') == -1) ? '?' : '&';
4441   script.src = url + separator + 'callback=' + callbackName;
4442   script.onerror = function (event) {
4443     // clean up created function and script
4444     document.body.removeChild(script);
4445     delete window[callbackName];
4446 
4447     if (errback) {
4448       errback();
4449     }
4450   };
4451   script.type = 'text/javascript';
4452   
4453   // create the temporary callback function
4454   window[callbackName] = function (data) {
4455     // clean up created function and script
4456     document.body.removeChild(script);
4457     delete window[callbackName];
4458 
4459     // call callback function with retrieved data
4460     if (callback) {
4461       callback(data);
4462     }
4463   }
4464   
4465   // inject the script in the document
4466   document.body.appendChild(script); 
4467   
4468   // TODO: built something to check for an error. only possible with a timeout?
4469 };

4472 /**
4473  * Event handler for drag start event
4474  */ 
4475 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.onDragStart = function(event) {
4476   // create a copy of the selection array
4477   /* TODO: cleanup
4478   var items = [];
4479   for (var i = 0; i < this.selection.length; i++) {
4480     var sel = this.selection[i];
4481     items.push(sel);
4482   }
4483   
4484   var dragImage = this.dom.dragImage;
4485   if (dragImage) {
4486     var count = items.length;
4487     dragImage.innerHTML = count + ' item' + ((count != 1) ? 's' : '');
4488   }
4489   event.dataTransfer.setData('items', items);
4490   */
4491   
4492   // check if there are selected items that can be dragged
4493   var items = [];
4494   for (var i = 0; i < this.selection.length; i++) {
4495     var sel = this.selection[i];
4496     
4497     var parent = sel.parent;
4498     var dataConnector = parent ? parent.dataConnector : undefined;
4499     var options = dataConnector ? dataConnector.options : undefined;
4500     var dataTransfer = options ? options.dataTransfer : undefined;
4501     var allowedEffect = dataTransfer ? dataTransfer.allowedEffect : undefined;
4502     
4503     // validate whether at least one of the items can be moved or copied
4504     if (allowedEffect != undefined && allowedEffect.toLowerCase() != 'none') {
4505       items.push(sel);
4506     }
4507   }
4508   
4509   if (items.length > 0) {
4510     var dragImage = this.dom.dragImage;
4511     if (dragImage) {
4512       var count = items.length;
4513       dragImage.innerHTML = count + ' item' + ((count != 1) ? 's' : '');
4514     }
4515     
4516     event.dataTransfer.setData('items', items);
4517     return true;
4518   }
4519   else {
4520     return false;
4521   }
4522 }

4524 /**
4525  * Event handler for drag start event
4526  */ 
4527 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.onDragEnd = function(event) {
4528   var dropEffect = event.dataTransfer.dropEffect;
4529   if (dropEffect == 'move') {
4530     var frame = this;
4531     var items = event.dataTransfer.getData('items');
4532     var callbacksInProgress = items.length;
4533 
4534     var callback = function () {
4535       callbacksInProgress--;
4536       if (callbacksInProgress == 0) {
4537         frame.unselect();
4538         frame.onResize();
4539       }
4540     }
4541     var errback = callback;
4542     
4543     for (var i = 0; i < items.length; i++) {
4544       var item = items[i];
4545       // FIXME: removing the item is a temporary hack. This only works
4546       //        in case of a single user, and prevents the state of the items
4547       //        (expanded or not) from being shifted.
4548       //        The real solution is to be able to really store the state of an 
4549       //        not on an index basis, but on an item basis. 
4550       //        Use a linked list instead of an array?
4551       item.parent._removeItem(item); 
4552 
4553       // TODO: not so nice accessing the parent grid this way...
4554       item.parent.dataConnector.removeItems([item.data], callback, errback);
4555     }
4556   }
4557   /* TODO
4558   else if (dropEffect == 'link') {
4559     // TODO: linkedItems    
4560   }
4561   else if (dropEffect == 'copy') {
4562     // TODO: copiedItems    
4563   }
4564   */
4565   
4566   // TODO: trigger event?
4567   
4568   this.repaint();
4569 }

4572 /**
4573  * A click event
4574  * @param {event}       event         The event that occurred
4575  */
4576 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.onMouseDown = function(event) {
4577   event = event || window.event;
4578 
4579   // only react on left mouse button down
4580   var params = this.eventParams;
4581   var leftButtonDown = event.which ? (event.which == 1) : (event.button == 1);
4582   if (!leftButtonDown && !params.touchDown) {
4583     return;
4584   }
4585 
4586   var target = links.TreeGrid.getTarget(event);
4587   
4588   if (target.treeGridType && target.treeGridType == 'expand') {
4589     target.grid.onExpand();
4590     links.TreeGrid.stopPropagation(event); // TODO: does not work
4591   }
4592   else if (target.treeGridType && target.treeGridType == 'action') {
4593     target.item.onEvent(target.event);
4594     links.TreeGrid.stopPropagation(event); // TODO: does not work
4595   }
4596   else {
4597     var item = links.TreeGrid.getItemFromTarget(target);
4598     if (item) {
4599       // select the item
4600       var keepSelection = event.ctrlKey;
4601       var selectRange = event.shiftKey;
4602       this.select(item, keepSelection, selectRange);
4603     }
4604     else {
4605       this.unselect();
4606     }
4607   }
4608 
4609   links.TreeGrid.preventDefault(event);
4610 };
4611 
4612 /**
4613  * Set given node selected
4614  * @param {links.TreeGrid.Node} node
4615  * @param {Boolean} keepSelection  If true, the current node is added to the 
4616  *                                 selection. append is false by default
4617  * @param {Boolean} selectRange    If true, a range of nodes is selected from
4618  *                                 the last selected node to this node
4619  */ 
4620 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.select = function(node, keepSelection, selectRange) {
4621   var triggerEvent = false;
4622 
4623   if (selectRange) {
4624     var startNode = this.selection.pop();
4625     var endNode = node;
4626 
4627     // ensure having nodes in the same grid
4628     if (startNode && startNode.parent != endNode.parent) {
4629       startNode.unselect();
4630       startNode.repaint();
4631       startNode = undefined;
4632     }
4633     if (!startNode) {
4634       startNode = endNode;
4635     }
4636     
4637     // remove selection
4638     while (this.selection.length) {
4639       var selectedNode = this.selection.pop();
4640       selectedNode.unselect();
4641       selectedNode.repaint();
4642     }
4643     
4644     var parent = startNode.parent;
4645     var startIndex = parent.items.indexOf(startNode);
4646     var endIndex = (startNode == endNode) ? startIndex : parent.items.indexOf(endNode);
4647     if (endIndex >= startIndex) {
4648       var index = startIndex;
4649       while (index <= endIndex) {
4650         var node = parent.items[index];
4651         node.select();
4652         node.repaint();
4653         this.selection.unshift(node);
4654         index++;
4655       }      
4656     }
4657     else {
4658       var index = startIndex;
4659       while (index >= endIndex) {
4660         var node = parent.items[index];
4661         node.select();
4662         node.repaint();
4663         
4664         // important to add to the beginning of the array, we want to keep
4665         // our 'start' node at the end of the selection array, needed when
4666         // we adjust this range.
4667         this.selection.unshift(node); 
4668         index--;
4669       }      
4670     }
4671   }
4672   else if (keepSelection) {
4673     // append this node to the selection
4674     var index = this.selection.indexOf(node);
4675     if (index == -1) {
4676       node.select();
4677       node.repaint();
4678       this.selection.push(node);    
4679     }
4680     else {
4681       node.unselect();
4682       node.repaint();
4683       this.selection.splice(index, 1);    
4684     }
4685   }
4686   else {
4687     if (!node.selected) {
4688       // remove selection
4689       while (this.selection.length) {
4690         var selectedNode = this.selection.pop();
4691         selectedNode.unselect();
4692         selectedNode.repaint();
4693       }
4694 
4695       // append this node to the selection
4696       node.select();
4697       node.repaint();
4698       this.selection.push(node); 
4699     }
4700   }
4701   
4702   // trigger selection event
4703   this.trigger('select', {
4704     //'index': node.index, // TOOD: cleanup
4705     'items': this.getSelection()
4706   });
4707 }
4708 
4709 
4710 /**
4711  * Unselect all selected nodes
4712  * @param {Boolean} triggerEvent  Optional. True by default
4713  */ 
4714 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.unselect = function(triggerEvent) {
4715   var selection = this.selection;
4716   for (var i = 0, iMax = selection.length; i < iMax; i++) {
4717     selection[i].unselect();
4718     selection[i].repaint();
4719   }
4720   this.selection = [];
4721 
4722   if (triggerEvent == undefined) {
4723     triggerEvent = true;
4724   }  
4725   
4726   // trigger selection event
4727   if (triggerEvent) {
4728     this.trigger('select', {
4729       'items': []
4730     });
4731   }
4732 }

4734 /**
4735  * Get the selected items
4736  * @param {Array with Objects} selected items
4737  */ 
4738 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.getSelection = function() {
4739   // create an array with the data of the selected items (instead of the items 
4740   // themselves)
4741   var selection = this.selection;
4742   var selectedData = [];
4743   for (var i = 0, iMax = selection.length; i < iMax; i++) {
4744     selectedData.push(selection[i].data);
4745   }
4746   
4747   return selectedData;
4748 }

4750 /**
4751  * Event handler for touchstart event on mobile devices 
4752  */ 
4753 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.onTouchStart = function(event) {
4754   var params = this.eventParams,
4755     me = this;
4756   
4757   if (params.touchDown) {
4758     // if already moving, return
4759     return;
4760   }
4761   
4762   params.startClientY = event.targetTouches[0].clientY;  
4763   params.currentClientY = params.startClientY;  
4764   params.previousClientY = params.startClientY;  
4765   params.startScrollValue = this.verticalScroll.get();
4766   params.touchDown = true;
4767 
4768   if (!params.onTouchMove) {
4769     params.onTouchMove = function (event) {me.onTouchMove(event);};
4770     links.TreeGrid.addEventListener(document, "touchmove", params.onTouchMove);
4771   }
4772   if (!params.onTouchEnd) {
4773     params.onTouchEnd  = function (event) {me.onTouchEnd(event);};
4774     links.TreeGrid.addEventListener(document, "touchend",  params.onTouchEnd);
4775   }
4776   
4777   // don't do preventDefault here, it will block onclick events...
4778   //links.TreeGrid.preventDefault(event); 
4779 };
4780 
4781 /**
4782  * Event handler for touchmove event on mobile devices 
4783  */ 
4784 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.onTouchMove = function(event) {
4785   var params = this.eventParams;
4786 
4787   var clientY = event.targetTouches[0].clientY;  
4788   var diff = (clientY - params.startClientY);
4789   this.verticalScroll.set(params.startScrollValue - diff);
4790 
4791   this.onResize();
4792 
4793   params.previousClientY = params.currentClientY;
4794   params.currentClientY = clientY;
4795 
4796   this.trigger('rangechange', undefined);
4797 
4798   links.TreeGrid.preventDefault(event);
4799 };
4800 
4801 
4802 /**
4803  * Event handler for touchend event on mobile devices 
4804  */ 
4805 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.onTouchEnd = function(event) {
4806   var params = this.eventParams,
4807     me = this;
4808   params.touchDown = false;
4809 
4810   var diff = (params.currentClientY - params.startClientY);
4811   var speed = (params.currentClientY - params.previousClientY);
4812   
4813   var decellerate = function () {
4814     if (!params.touchDown) {
4815       me.verticalScroll.set(params.startScrollValue - diff);
4816 
4817       me.onRangeChange();
4818 
4819       diff += speed;
4820       speed *= 0.8;
4821 
4822       if (Math.abs(speed) > 1) {
4823         setTimeout(decellerate, 50);
4824       }
4825     }
4826   }
4827   decellerate();
4828 
4829   this.trigger("rangechanged", undefined);
4830 
4831   if (params.onTouchMove) {
4832     links.TreeGrid.removeEventListener(document, "touchmove", params.onTouchMove);
4833     delete params.onTouchMove;
4834     
4835   }
4836   if (params.onTouchEnd) {
4837     links.TreeGrid.removeEventListener(document, "touchend",  params.onTouchEnd); 
4838     delete params.onTouchEnd;
4839   }
4840   
4841   links.TreeGrid.preventDefault(event);
4842 };
4843 
4844 /** 
4845  * Event handler for mouse wheel event, 
4846  * Code from http://adomas.org/javascript-mouse-wheel/
4847  * @param {event}  event
4848  */
4849 links.TreeGrid.Frame.prototype.onMouseWheel = function(event) {
4850   if (!event) { /* For IE. */
4851     event = window.event;
4852   }
4853 
4854   // retrieve delta    
4855   var delta = 0;
4856   if (event.wheelDelta) { /* IE/Opera. */
4857     delta = event.wheelDelta/120;
4858   } else if (event.detail) { /* Mozilla case. */
4859     // In Mozilla, sign of delta is different than in IE.
4860     // Also, delta is multiple of 3.
4861     delta = -event.detail/3;
4862   }
4863 
4864   // If delta is nonzero, handle it.
4865   // Basically, delta is now positive if wheel was scrolled up,
4866   // and negative, if wheel was scrolled down.
4867   if (delta) {
4868     // TODO: on FireFox, the window is not redrawn within repeated scroll-events 
4869     // -> use a delayed redraw? Make a zoom queue?
4870 
4871     this.verticalScroll.increase(-delta * 50);
4872     
4873     this.onRangeChange();
4874 
4875     // fire a rangechanged event
4876     this.trigger('rangechanged', undefined);
4877   }
4878 
4879   // Prevent default actions caused by mouse wheel.
4880   // That might be ugly, but we handle scrolls somehow
4881   // anyway, so don't bother here...
4882   links.TreeGrid.preventDefault(event);
4883 };
4884

4886 /**
4887  * fire an event
4888  * @param {String} event   The name of an event, for example 'rangechange' or 'edit'
4889  * @param {Object} params  Optional object with parameters
4890  */
4891 links.TreeGrid.prototype.trigger = function (event, params) {
4892   // trigger the links event bus
4893   links.events.trigger(this, event, params); 
4894   
4895   // trigger the google event bus
4896   if (google && google.visualization && google.visualization.events) {
4897     google.visualization.events.trigger(this, event, params);    
4898   }
4899 };
