4902 
4903 /** ------------------------------------------------------------------------ **/
4904 /**
4905  * Drag and Drop library
4906  * 
4907  * This module allows to create draggable and droppable elements in a webpage,
4908  * and easy transfer of data of any type between drag and drop areas.
4909  * 
4910  * The interface of the library is equal to the 'real' drag and drop API. 
4911  * However, this library works on all browsers without issues (in contrast to
4912  * the official drag and drop API).
4913  * https://developer.mozilla.org/En/DragDrop/Drag_and_Drop
4914  * 
4915  * The library is tested on: Chrome, Firefox, Opera, Safari, 
4916  * Internet Explorer 5.5+
4917  * 
4918  * DOCUMENTATION
4919  * 
4920  * To create a draggable area, use the method makeDraggable:
4921  *   dnd.makeDraggable(element, options);
4922  * 
4923  * with parameters: 
4924  *   {HTMLElement} element   The element to become draggable.
4925  *   {Object}      options   An object with options.
4926  * 
4927  * available options:
4928  *   {String} effectAllowed  The allowed drag effect. Available values:
4929  *                           'copy', 'move', 'link', 'copyLink', 
4930  *                           'copyMove', 'linkMove', 'all', 'none'.
4931  *                           Default value is 'all'.
4932  *   {String or HTMLElement} dragImage
4933  *                           Image to be used as drag image. If no
4934  *                           drag image is provided, an opague clone
4935  *                           of the drag area is used.
4936  *   {Number} dragImageOffsetX
4937  *                           Horizontal offset for the drag image
4938  *   {Number} dragImageOffsetY
4939  *                           Vertical offset for the drag image
4940  *   {function} dragStart    Method called once on start of a drag. 
4941  *                           The method is called with an event object
4942  *                           as parameter. The event object contains a
4943  *                           parameter 'data' to pass data to a drop
4944  *                           event. This data can be any type. 
4945  *   {function} drag         Method called repeatedly while dragging.              
4946  *                           The method is called with an event object
4947  *                           as parameter. 
4948  *   {function} dragEnd      Method called after the drag event is 
4949  *                           finished. The method is called with an 
4950  *                           event object as parameter. This event 
4951  *                           object contains a parameter 'dropEffect'
4952  *                           with the applied drop effect, which is 
4953  *                           undefined when no drop occurred.
4954  *
4955  * To make a droppable area, use the method makeDroppable:
4956  *   dnd.makeDroppable(element, options);
4957  * 
4958  * with parameters:
4959  *   {HTMLElement} element   The element to become droppable.
4960  *   {Object}      options   An object with options.
4961  * 
4962  * available options:
4963  *   {String} dropEffect     The drop effect. Available 
4964  *                           values: 'copy', 'move', 'link', 'none'.
4965  *                           Default value is 'link'
4966  *   {function} dragEnter    Method called once when the dragged image
4967  *                           enters the drop area. Can be used to 
4968  *                           apply visual effects to the drop area.
4969  *   {function} dragLeave    Method called once when the dragged image
4970  *                           leaves the drop area. Can be used to 
4971  *                           remove visual effects from the drop area.
4972  *   {function} dragOver     Method called repeatedly when moving
4973  *                           over the drop area. 
4974  *   {function} drop         Method called when the drag image is 
4975  *                           dropped on this drop area. 
4976  *                           The method is called with an event object
4977  *                           as parameter. The event object contains a
4978  *                           parameter 'data' which can contain data
4979  *                           provided by the drag area. 
4980  * 
4981  * Created draggable or doppable areas are registed in the drag and
4982  * drop module. To remove a draggable or droppable area, the
4983  * following methods can be used respectively:
4984  *   dnd.removeDraggable(element);
4985  *   dnd.removeDroppable(element);
4986  * 
4987  * which removes all drag and drop functionality from the concerning
4988  * element.
4989  * 
4990  * 
4991  * EXAMPLE
4992  * 
4993  *   var drag = document.getElementById('drag');
4994  *   dnd.makeDraggable(drag, {
4995  *     'dragStart': function (event) {
4996  *       event.data = 'Hello World!'; // data can be any type
4997  *     }
4998  *   });
4999  * 
5000  *   var drop = document.getElementById('drop');
5001  *   dnd.makeDroppable(drop, {
5002  *     'drop': function (event) {
5003  *       alert(event.data);                     // will alert 'Hello World!'
5004  *     },
5005  *     'dragEnter': function (event) {
5006  *       drop.style.backgroundColor = 'yellow'; // set visual effect
5007  *     },
5008  *     'dragLeave': function (event) {
5009  *       drop.style.backgroundColor = '';       // remove visual effect
5010  *     }
5011  *   });
5012  * 
5013  * 
5014  * @license
5015  * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not
5016  * use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy 
5017  * of the License at
5018  * 
5019  * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
5020  * 
5021  * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
5022  * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT
5023  * WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the
5024  * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under
5025  * the License.
5026  *
5027  * Copyright (c) 2011-2012 Almende B.V. <http://www.almende.com>
5028  *
5029  * @author Jos de Jong <jos@almende.org>
5030  * @date   2012-02-09
5031  */
5032 links.dnd = function () {
5033   var dragAreas = [];              // all registered drag areas
5034   var dropAreas = [];              // all registered drop areas
5035 
5036   var dragArea = undefined;        // currently dragged area
5037   var dragImage = undefined;
5038   var dragImageOffsetX = 0;
5039   var dragImageOffsetY = 0;
5040   var dragEvent = {};              // object with event properties, passed to each event
5041   var mouseMove = undefined;
5042   var mouseUp = undefined;
5043   var originalCursor = undefined;
5044 
5045   function isDragging() {
5046     return (dragArea != undefined);
5047   }
5048 
5049   /**
5050    * Make an HTML element draggable
5051    * @param {HTML DOM} element
5052    * @param {Object} options. available parameters:
5053    *                 {String} effectAllowed
5054    *                 {String or HTML DOM} dragImage
5055    *                 {function} dragStart
5056    *                 {function} dragEnd
5057    */ 
5058   function makeDraggable (element, options) {
5059     // create an object holding the dragarea and options
5060     var newDragArea = {
5061       'element': element
5062     };
5063     if (options) {
5064       links.TreeGrid.extend(newDragArea, options);
5065     }
5066     dragAreas.push(newDragArea);
5067 
5068     var mouseDown = function (event) {
5069       var event = event || window.event;
5070       var leftButtonDown = event.which ? (event.which == 1) : (event.button == 1);
5071       if (!leftButtonDown) {
5072         return;
5073       }
5074       
5075       // create mousemove listener
5076       mouseMove = function (event) {
5077         if (!isDragging()) {
5078           dragStart(event, newDragArea);
5079         }
5080         dragOver(event);
5081 
5082         preventDefault(event);
5083       };
5084       addEventListener(document, 'mousemove', mouseMove);  
5085 
5086       // create mouseup listener
5087       mouseUp = function (event) {
5088         if (isDragging()) {
5089           dragEnd(event);
5090         }
5091 
5092         // remove event listeners
5093         if (mouseMove) {
5094           removeEventListener(document, 'mousemove', mouseMove);
5095           mouseMove = undefined;
5096         }
5097         if (mouseUp) {
5098           removeEventListener(document, 'mouseup', mouseUp);
5099           mouseUp = undefined;
5100         }
5101         
5102         preventDefault(event);
5103       };
5104       addEventListener(document, 'mouseup', mouseUp);
5105 
5106       preventDefault(event);
5107     };
5108     addEventListener(element, 'mousedown', mouseDown);
5109 
5110     newDragArea.mouseDown = mouseDown;
5111   }
5112 
5113 
5114   /**
5115    * Make an HTML element droppable
5116    * @param {HTML DOM} element
5117    * @param {Object} options. available parameters:
5118    *                 {String} dropEffect
5119    *                 {function} dragEnter
5120    *                 {function} dragLeave
5121    *                 {function} drop
5122    */ 
5123   function makeDroppable (element, options) {
5124     var newDropArea = {
5125       'element': element,
5126       'mouseOver': false
5127     };
5128     if (options) {
5129       links.TreeGrid.extend(newDropArea, options);
5130     }
5131     if (!newDropArea.dropEffect) {
5132       newDropArea.dropEffect = 'link';
5133     }
5134     
5135     dropAreas.push(newDropArea);
5136   }
5137 
5138   /**
5139    * Remove draggable functionality from element
5140    * @param {HTML DOM} element
5141    */ 
5142   function removeDraggable (element) {
5143     var i = 0;
5144     while (i < dragAreas.length) {
5145       var d = dragAreas[i];
5146       if (d.element == element) {
5147         removeEventListener(d.element, 'mousedown', d.mouseDown);
5148         dragAreas.splice(i, 1);
5149       }
5150       else {
5151         i++;
5152       }
5153     }    
5154   }
5155   
5156   /**
5157    * Remove droppabe functionality from element
5158    * @param {HTML DOM} element
5159    */ 
5160   function removeDroppable (element) {
5161     var i = 0;
5162     while (i < dropAreas.length) {
5163       if (dropAreas[i].element == element) {
5164         dropAreas.splice(i, 1);
5165       }
5166       else {
5167         i++;
5168       }
5169     }
5170   }
5171 
5172   function dragStart(event, newDragArea) {
5173     // register the dragarea
5174     if (dragArea) {
5175       return;
5176     }
5177     dragArea = newDragArea;
5178     
5179     // trigger event
5180     var proceed = true;
5181     if (dragArea.dragStart) {
5182       var data = {};
5183       dragEvent = {
5184         'dataTransfer' : {
5185           'dragArea': dragArea.element,
5186           'dropArea': undefined,
5187           'data': data,
5188           'getData': function (key) {
5189             return data[key];
5190           },
5191           'setData': function (key, value) {
5192             data[key] = value; 
5193           },
5194           'clearData': function (key) {
5195             delete data[key];
5196           }
5197         },
5198         'clientX': event.clientX,
5199         'clientY': event.clientY
5200       };
5201       
5202       var ret = dragArea.dragStart(dragEvent);
5203       proceed = (ret !== false);
5204     }
5205     
5206     if (!proceed) {
5207       // cancel dragevent
5208       dragArea = undefined;
5209       return;
5210     }
5211 
5212     // create dragImage
5213     var clone = undefined;
5214     dragImage = document.createElement('div');
5215     dragImage.style.position = 'absolute';
5216     if (typeof(dragArea.dragImage) == 'string') {
5217 	  // create dragImage from HTML string
5218       dragImage.innerHTML = dragArea.dragImage;
5219       dragImageOffsetX = -dragArea.dragImageOffsetX || 0;
5220       dragImageOffsetY = -dragArea.dragImageOffsetY || 0;
5221     }
5222     else if (dragArea.dragImage) {
5223 	  // create dragImage from HTML DOM element
5224       dragImage.appendChild(dragArea.dragImage);
5225       dragImageOffsetX = -dragArea.dragImageOffsetX || 0;
5226       dragImageOffsetY = -dragArea.dragImageOffsetY || 0;
5227     }
5228     else {
5229       // clone the drag area
5230       var clone = dragArea.element.cloneNode(true);
5231       dragImageOffsetX = (event.clientX || 0) - getAbsoluteLeft(dragArea.element);
5232       dragImageOffsetY = (event.clientY || 0) - getAbsoluteTop(dragArea.element);
5233       clone.style.left = '0px';
5234       clone.style.top = '0px';
5235       clone.style.opacity = '0.7';
5236       clone.style.filter = 'alpha(opacity=70)';
5237       
5238       dragImage.appendChild(clone);
5239     }
5240     document.body.appendChild(dragImage);
5241 
5242     // adjust the cursor
5243     if (originalCursor == undefined) {
5244       originalCursor = document.body.style.cursor;
5245     }
5246     document.body.style.cursor = 'move';
5247   }
5248 
5249   function dragOver (event) {
5250     if (!dragImage) {
5251       return;
5252     }
5253     
5254     // adjust position of the dragImage
5255     if (dragImage) {
5256       dragImage.style.left = (event.clientX - dragImageOffsetX) + 'px';
5257       dragImage.style.top = (event.clientY - dragImageOffsetY) + 'px';
5258     }
5259     
5260     // adjust event properties
5261     dragEvent.clientX = event.clientX;
5262     dragEvent.clientY = event.clientY;
5263     
5264     // find center of the drag area
5265     var left = (event.clientX - dragImageOffsetX);
5266     var top = (event.clientY - dragImageOffsetY);
5267     var width = dragImage.clientWidth || dragArea.element.clientWidth;
5268     var height = dragImage.clientHeight || dragArea.element.clientHeight;
5269     var x = left + width / 2;
5270     var y = top + height / 2;
5271     // console.log(dragImageOffsetX, x, left, width, dragImageOffsetY, y, top, height)
5272 
5273     // check if there is a droparea overlapping with current dragarea
5274     var currentDropArea = undefined;
5275     for (var i = 0; i < dropAreas.length; i++) {
5276       var dropArea = dropAreas[i];
5277       var left = getAbsoluteLeft(dropArea.element)
5278       var top = getAbsoluteTop(dropArea.element);
5279       var width = dropArea.element.clientWidth;
5280       var height = dropArea.element.clientHeight;
5281       
5282       if (x > left && x < left + width && y > top && y < top + height && 
5283           !currentDropArea &&
5284           getAllowedDropEffect(dragArea.effectAllowed, dropArea.dropEffect)) {
5285         // on droparea
5286         currentDropArea = dropArea;
5287 
5288         if (!dropArea.mouseOver) {
5289           if (dropArea.dragEnter) {
5290             dragEvent.dataTransfer.dropArea = dropArea;
5291             dragEvent.dataTransfer.dropEffect = undefined;
5292             dropArea.dragEnter(dragEvent);
5293           }
5294           dropArea.mouseOver = true;
5295         }
5296       }
5297       else {
5298         // not on droparea
5299         if (dropArea.mouseOver) {
5300           if (dropArea.dragLeave) {
5301             dragEvent.dataTransfer.dropArea = dropArea;
5302             dragEvent.dataTransfer.dropEffect = undefined;
5303             dropArea.dragLeave(dragEvent);
5304           }
5305           dropArea.mouseOver = false;
5306         }
5307       }
5308     }
5309     
5310     // adjust event properties
5311     if (currentDropArea) {
5312       dragEvent.dataTransfer.dropArea = currentDropArea.element;
5313       dragEvent.dataTransfer.dropEffect = 
5314         getAllowedDropEffect(dragArea.effectAllowed, currentDropArea.dropEffect);
5315       
5316       if (currentDropArea.dragOver) {
5317         currentDropArea.dragOver(dragEvent);
5318         
5319         // TODO
5320         // // dropEffecct may be changed during dragOver
5321         //currentDropArea.dropEffect = dragEvent.dataTransfer.dropEffect;
5322       }
5323     }
5324     else {
5325       dragEvent.dataTransfer.dropArea = undefined;
5326       dragEvent.dataTransfer.dropEffect = undefined;
5327     }
5328 
5329     if (dragArea.drag) {
5330       // dragEvent.dataTransfer.effectAllowed = dragArea.effectAllowed;
5331 
5332       dragArea.drag(dragEvent);
5333       
5334       // TODO
5335       // // effectAllowed may be changed during drag
5336       // dragArea.effectAllowed = dragEvent.dataTransfer.effectAllowed;
5337     }    
5338   }
5339 
5340   function dragEnd (event) {
5341     // remove the dragImage
5342     if (dragImage && dragImage.parentNode) {
5343       dragImage.parentNode.removeChild(dragImage);
5344     }
5345     dragImage = undefined;
5346 
5347     // restore cursor
5348     document.body.style.cursor = originalCursor || '';
5349     originalCursor = undefined;
5350 
5351     var currentDropArea = undefined;
5352     for (var i = 0; i < dropAreas.length; i++) {
5353       var dropArea = dropAreas[i];
5354       
5355       // perform mouse leave event
5356       if (dropArea.mouseOver) {
5357         if (dropArea.dragLeave) {
5358           dropArea.dragLeave(dragEvent);
5359         }
5360         dropArea.mouseOver = false;      
5361         
5362         // perform drop event
5363         if (!currentDropArea) {
5364           currentDropArea = dropArea;
5365         }
5366       }
5367     }
5368 
5369     if (currentDropArea) {
5370       // adjust event properties
5371       dragEvent.dataTransfer.dropArea = currentDropArea.element;
5372       dragEvent.dataTransfer.dropEffect = 
5373         getAllowedDropEffect(dragArea.effectAllowed, currentDropArea.dropEffect);
5374 
5375       // trigger drop event
5376       if (dragEvent.dataTransfer.dropEffect) { 
5377         if (currentDropArea.drop) {
5378           currentDropArea.drop(dragEvent);
5379         }
5380       }
5381     }
5382     else {
5383       dragEvent.dataTransfer.dropArea = undefined;
5384       dragEvent.dataTransfer.dropEffect = undefined;
5385     }
5386     
5387     // trigger dragEnd event
5388     if (dragArea.dragEnd) {
5389       dragArea.dragEnd(dragEvent);
5390     }
5391 
5392     // remove the dragArea
5393     dragArea = undefined;
5394     
5395     // clear event data
5396     dragEvent = {};
5397   };
5398 
5399   /**
5400    * Return the current dropEffect, taking into account the allowed drop effects
5401    * @param {String} effectAllowed
5402    * @param {String} dropEffect
5403    * @return allowedDropEffect      the allowed dropEffect, or undefined when
5404    *                                not allowed
5405    */ 
5406   function getAllowedDropEffect (effectAllowed, dropEffect) {
5407     if (!dropEffect || dropEffect == 'none') {
5408       // none
5409       return undefined;
5410     }
5411     
5412     if (!effectAllowed || effectAllowed.toLowerCase() == 'all') {
5413       // all
5414       return dropEffect;
5415     }
5416 
5417     if (effectAllowed.toLowerCase().indexOf(dropEffect.toLowerCase()) != -1 ) {    
5418       return dropEffect;
5419     }
5420 
5421     return undefined;
5422   };
5423 
5424   /**
5425    * Add and event listener. Works for all browsers
5426    * @param {DOM Element} element    An html element
5427    * @param {string}      action     The action, for example 'click', 
5428    *                                 without the prefix 'on'
5429    * @param {function}    listener   The callback function to be executed
5430    * @param {boolean}     useCapture
5431    */ 
5432   function addEventListener (element, action, listener, useCapture) {
5433     if (element.addEventListener) {
5434       if (useCapture === undefined) {
5435         useCapture = false;
5436       }
5437 
5438       if (action === 'mousewheel' && navigator.userAgent.indexOf('Firefox') >= 0) {
5439         action = 'DOMMouseScroll';  // For Firefox
5440       }
5441         
5442       element.addEventListener(action, listener, useCapture);
5443     } else {    
5444       element.attachEvent('on' + action, listener);  // IE browsers
5445     }
5446   };
5447 
5448   /**
5449    * Remove an event listener from an element
5450    * @param {DOM element}  element   An html dom element
5451    * @param {string}       action    The name of the event, for example 'mousedown'
5452    * @param {function}     listener  The listener function
5453    * @param {boolean}      useCapture
5454    */ 
5455   function removeEventListener (element, action, listener, useCapture) {
5456     if (element.removeEventListener) {
5457       // non-IE browsers
5458       if (useCapture === undefined) {
5459         useCapture = false;    
5460       }
5461             
5462       if (action === 'mousewheel' && navigator.userAgent.indexOf('Firefox') >= 0) {
5463         action = 'DOMMouseScroll';  // For Firefox
5464       }
5465         
5466       element.removeEventListener(action, listener, useCapture); 
5467     } else {
5468       // IE browsers
5469       element.detachEvent('on' + action, listener);
5470     }
5471   };
5472 
5473   /**
5474    * Stop event propagation
5475    */ 
5476   function stopPropagation (event) {
5477     if (!event) 
5478       var event = window.event;
5479     
5480     if (event.stopPropagation) {
5481       event.stopPropagation();  // non-IE browsers
5482     }
5483     else {
5484       event.cancelBubble = true;  // IE browsers
5485     }
5486   };
5487 
5488   /**
5489    * Cancels the event if it is cancelable, without stopping further propagation of the event.
5490    */ 
5491   function preventDefault (event) {
5492     if (!event) 
5493       var event = window.event;
5494     
5495     if (event.preventDefault) {
5496       event.preventDefault();  // non-IE browsers
5497     }
5498     else {    
5499       event.returnValue = false;  // IE browsers
5500     }
5501   };
5502 
5503 
5504   /**
5505    * Retrieve the absolute left value of a DOM element
5506    * @param {DOM element} elem    A dom element, for example a div
5507    * @return {number} left        The absolute left position of this element
5508    *                              in the browser page.
5509    */ 
5510   function getAbsoluteLeft (elem) {
5511     var left = 0;
5512     while( elem != null ) {
5513       left += elem.offsetLeft;
5514       //left -= elem.srcollLeft;  // TODO: adjust for scroll positions. check if it works in IE too
5515       elem = elem.offsetParent;
5516     }
5517     return left;
5518   };
5519 
5520   /**
5521    * Retrieve the absolute top value of a DOM element
5522    * @param {DOM element} elem    A dom element, for example a div
5523    * @return {number} top        The absolute top position of this element
5524    *                              in the browser page.
5525    */ 
5526   function getAbsoluteTop (elem) {
5527     var top = 0;
5528     while( elem != null ) {
5529       top += elem.offsetTop;
5530       //left -= elem.srcollLeft;  // TODO: adjust for scroll positions. check if it works in IE too
5531       elem = elem.offsetParent;
5532     }
5533     return top;
5534   };
5535 
5536   // return public methods
5537   return {
5538     'makeDraggable': makeDraggable,
5539     'makeDroppable': makeDroppable,
5540     'removeDraggable': removeDraggable,
5541     'removeDroppable': removeDroppable
5542   };
5543 }();

5548 
5549 
5550 /** 
5551  * Event bus for adding and removing event listeners and for triggering events.
5552  * This is a singleton.
5553  */ 
5554 links.events = links.events || {
5555   'listeners': [],
5556 
5557   /**
5558    * Find a single listener by its object
5559    * @param {Object} object
5560    * @return {Number} index  -1 when not found 
5561    */  
5562   'indexOf': function (object) {
5563     var listeners = this.listeners;
5564     for (var i = 0, iMax = this.listeners.length; i < iMax; i++) {
5565       var listener = listeners[i];
5566       if (listener && listener.object == object) {
5567         return i;
5568       }
5569     }
5570     return -1;
5571   },
5572 
5573   /**
5574    * Add an event listener
5575    * @param {Object} object
5576    * @param {String} event       The name of an event, for example 'select'
5577    * @param {function} callback  The callback method, called when the 
5578    *                             event takes place
5579    */ 
5580   'addListener': function (object, event, callback) {
5581     var index = this.indexOf(object);
5582     var listener = this.listeners[index]; 
5583     if (!listener) {
5584       listener = {
5585         'object': object,
5586         'events': {}
5587       };
5588       this.listeners.push(listener);
5589     }
5590     
5591     var callbacks = listener.events[event];
5592     if (!callbacks) {
5593       callbacks = [];
5594       listener.events[event] = callbacks;
5595     }
5596     
5597     // add the callback if it does not yet exist
5598     if (callbacks.indexOf(callback) == -1) {
5599       callbacks.push(callback);
5600     }
5601   },
5602   
5603   /**
5604    * Remove an event listener
5605    * @param {Object} object      
5606    * @param {String} event       The name of an event, for example 'select'
5607    * @param {function} callback  The registered callback method
5608    */ 
5609   'removeListener': function (object, event, callback) {
5610     var index = this.indexOf(object);
5611     var listener = this.listeners[index]; 
5612     if (listener) {
5613       var callbacks = listener.events[event];      
5614       if (callbacks) {
5615         var index = callbacks.indexOf(callback);
5616         if (index != -1) {
5617           callbacks.splice(index, 1);
5618         }
5619         
5620         // remove the array when empty
5621         if (callbacks.length == 0) {
5622           delete listener.events[event];
5623         }
5624       }
5625 
5626       // count the number of registered events. remove listener when empty
5627       var count = 0;
5628       var events = listener.events;
5629       for (var event in events) {
5630         if (events.hasOwnProperty(event)) {
5631           count++;
5632         }
5633       }
5634       if (count == 0) {
5635         delete this.listeners[index];
5636       }
5637     }
5638   },
5639 
5640   /**
5641    * Remove all registered event listeners
5642    */ 
5643   'removeAllListeners': function () {
5644     this.listeners = [];
5645   },
5646   
5647   /**
5648    * Trigger an event. All registered event handlers will be called
5649    * @param {Object} object
5650    * @param {String} event
5651    * @param {Object} params (optional)
5652    */ 
5653   'trigger': function (object, event, params) {
5654     var index = this.indexOf(object);
5655     var listener = this.listeners[index]; 
5656     if (listener) {
5657       var callbacks = listener.events[event];
5658       if (callbacks) {
5659         for (var i = 0, iMax = callbacks.length; i < iMax; i++) {
5660           callbacks[i](params);
5661         }
5662       }
5663     }
5664   }
5665 };
5666 
5667 
5668 
5669 
5670 /** ------------------------------------------------------------------------ **/
5671 
5672 
5673 /**
5674  * Add and event listener. Works for all browsers
5675  * @param {DOM Element} element    An html element
5676  * @param {string}      action     The action, for example 'click', 
5677  *                                 without the prefix 'on'
5678  * @param {function}    listener   The callback function to be executed
5679  * @param {boolean}     useCapture
5680  */ 
5681 links.TreeGrid.addEventListener = function (element, action, listener, useCapture) {
5682   if (element.addEventListener) {
5683     if (useCapture === undefined) {
5684       useCapture = false;
5685     }
5686       
5687     if (action === 'mousewheel' && navigator.userAgent.indexOf('Firefox') >= 0) {
5688       action = 'DOMMouseScroll';  // For Firefox
5689     }
5690       
5691     element.addEventListener(action, listener, useCapture);
5692   } else {    
5693     element.attachEvent('on' + action, listener);  // IE browsers
5694   }
5695 };
5696 
5697 /**
5698  * Remove an event listener from an element
5699  * @param {DOM element}  element   An html dom element
5700  * @param {string}       action    The name of the event, for example 'mousedown'
5701  * @param {function}     listener  The listener function
5702  * @param {boolean}      useCapture
5703  */ 
5704 links.TreeGrid.removeEventListener = function(element, action, listener, useCapture) {
5705   if (element.removeEventListener) {
5706     // non-IE browsers
5707     if (useCapture === undefined) {
5708       useCapture = false;    
5709     }
5710           
5711     if (action === 'mousewheel' && navigator.userAgent.indexOf('Firefox') >= 0) {
5712       action = 'DOMMouseScroll';  // For Firefox
5713     }
5714       
5715     element.removeEventListener(action, listener, useCapture); 
5716   } else {
5717     // IE browsers
5718     element.detachEvent('on' + action, listener);
5719   }
5720 };
5721 
5722 
5723 /**
5724  * Get HTML element which is the target of the event
5725  * @param {MouseEvent} event
5726  * @return {HTML DOM} target element
5727  */ 
5728 links.TreeGrid.getTarget = function (event) {
5729   // code from http://www.quirksmode.org/js/events_properties.html
5730   if (!event) {
5731     var event = window.event;
5732   }
5733 
5734   var target;
5735   
5736   if (event.target) {
5737     target = event.target;
5738   }
5739   else if (event.srcElement) {
5740     target = event.srcElement;
5741   }
5742   
5743   if (target.nodeType !== undefined && target.nodeType == 3) {
5744     // defeat Safari bug
5745     target = target.parentNode;
5746   }
5747   
5748   return target;
5749 }
5750 
5751 /**
5752  * Recursively find the treegrid item of which this target element is a part of.
5753  * @param {HTML DOM} target
5754  * @return {links.TreeGrid.Item} item    Item or undefined when not found
5755  */ 
5756 links.TreeGrid.getItemFromTarget = function (target) {
5757   var elem = target;
5758   while (elem) {
5759     if (elem.treeGridType == 'item' && elem.item) {
5760       return elem.item;
5761     }
5762     elem = elem.parentElement;
5763   }
5764   
5765   return undefined;
5766 }
5767 
5768 /**
5769  * Stop event propagation
5770  */ 
5771 links.TreeGrid.stopPropagation = function (event) {
5772   if (!event) {
5773     var event = window.event;
5774   }
5775   
5776   if (event.stopPropagation) {
5777     event.stopPropagation();  // non-IE browsers
5778   }
5779   else {
5780     event.cancelBubble = true;  // IE browsers
5781   }
5782 };
5783 
5784 
5785 /**
5786  * Cancels the event if it is cancelable, without stopping further propagation of the event.
5787  */ 
5788 links.TreeGrid.preventDefault = function (event) {
5789   if (!event) {
5790     var event = window.event;
5791   }
5792   
5793   if (event.preventDefault) {
5794     event.preventDefault();  // non-IE browsers
5795   }
5796   else {    
5797     event.returnValue = false;  // IE browsers
5798   }
5799 };
